138501.name: Disc-Continuity
138501.description:
from the back of the book

A role playing game of multidimensional humour set in the universe world of Disc-Continuity. You can explore the strange realms where reality is a changeable concept and the laws of physics are subject to repeal. Soar above the treacherous dimensional portals of the Shifting lands in magical Sky Galleons or explore the twisting 3D maze of Shieun city roads to shop in the Bazaar for products from every corner of the multiverse. Did anybody spot the deliberate mistake on the front? If you did, award yourself a no-prize.

rpg: The Committee for the Exploration of Mysteries
138502.name: The Committee for the Exploration of Mysteries (Game Chef)
138502.description:
From the author:
As the 1930s begin, the Committee for the Exploration of Mysteries and the Enlightenment of Mankind is the foremost institution of learning and research in the world. You are esteemed members of the Committee, each a pulp hero of the first order, and you are all newly returned from an expedition to discover an ancient city and the lost secrets hidden there. Now you sit before the assembled Committee to give a full report of your expedition. Each of you harbors the same desire in your heart–to be recognized as the first among equals and to garner the most acclaim for your incomparable contributions to the expedition's success.

138503.name: Interface Zero 2.0: Full Metal Cyberpunk
rpghonor: 2015 ENnie for Best Art, Interior - Nominee
138503.description:
From publisher blurb:


FULL METAL CYBERPUNK!

In a not-so-distant future, the world has been ravaged by global warming, subjected to the horrors of nuclear war and natural disaster, witnessed the collapse of the mightiest nation in the history of the world, and the rise of other nations to take its place. In East Asia, the Bear and the Dragon battle for control of the resource-rich continent, and an emergent A.I. known only as Charon has destabilized the whole of Europe, sparking revolution and chaos not seen since the Second World War.

On the North American continent, the prospect of conflict once again rears its ugly head as terrorist bombings in Atlantica, bring the nation to the brink of war with the North American Coalition. Is this the work of Charon, as well, or are other forces moving behind the scenes? Only time will tell.

Science has hacked the genome, unlocking the secrets of DNA to facilitate the creation of new breeds of human; genetic hybrids, human 2.0, and even simulacrum— a slave race grown in amniotic vats and sold on the open market. Cybernetic technology has reached the point where those with the money and the will to do so, can become living machines. Computer science has grown by leaps and bounds as well.

Dubbed Interface Zero by those who created it, the Tendril Access Processor—or TAP—downloads the Global DataNet and Hyper Reality directly into the minds of billions of users across the solar system, bringing the world an unparalleled level of interconnectivity, and danger. Malware plagues the Deep, and hackers manipulate the Tendril Access Processor to upload malicious virii, steal secrets, and even the identities of the unwary.

This is the world in 2090, omae; let’s hope you survive it.

Interface Zero 2.0 is a cyberpunk game powered by the Savage Worlds game system. Play bioroids, full-metal cyborgs, vat-grown simulacra, genetic hybrids, Human 2.0, and even androids! Hack the world around you with our revised hacking rules, or take control of a drone and lay down some fire-support for your team! Get cybered with new cybernetics using our Fast Furious and Fun rules!

138504.name: Modron: City of the River Goddess
138504.description:
From publisher blurb:

This download is an overview of the city of Modron and the undersea area beneath the nearby waves. While this download does expand on some material in the original product, it does not approach in detail the original Judges Guild product Modron, by Bob Bledsaw and Gary Adams.

138505.name: Rorystone Road
138505.description:
From publisher blurb:

The accompanying map details an area known as “Rorystone Road,” which runs north from the City State to the dwarven fortress of Thunderhold. Because the area of the City State of the Invincible Overlord is so crucial to most Wilderlands campaigns, the Rorystone Road area is provided here in greater detail than the Gazetteer fashion of the rest of this book. This download contains enough information for you to begin a campaign in the core area of the Wilderlands right away!

138506.name: Thunderhold: Castle of the Dwarven King
138506.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dwarves of Thunderhold originated at the Majestic Fastness, deep in the Majestic Mountains. They were forced from their ancestral home by the great dragon, Analegorn, and its three young some 400 years ago. The Dwarves journeyed north to the region of the Sunstone Caverns, rumored to possess a lode of mithral. There the dwarves found an army of gnolls who held the caverns and the adjacent castle.

138507.name: Lesser Races of the Wilderlands
138507.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Judges Guild Wilderlands Campaign setting includes an incredible array of races and creatures. The Player's Guide to the Wilderlands details many of the more common races, but it would have taken a work the size of that book alone to have detailed all of the races conceived by Bob Bledsaw and the Judges Guild staff. Here are some of the races that did not find their way into the Player's Guide but are still important to the setting. Except for the swerting, which are an unfortunate plague on the lands, the other races detailed here are rare and few in number. Most are shunned by other humanoids and as a result these races often form small communities of their own, which rarely number more than 100—200.

138508.name: Bit Shift
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 24 Hey! You Got Euphoria In My Dystopia!
138508.description:
Bit Shift is a game of wits and bits. Each player​​ gets a handful of cards with a combination of 0's and 1's and must get the central board, which also consists of 0's and 1's, to match the cards in their hand.

Each player takes turns modifying the board to try and either score or try to prevent their opponents from scoring!

138509.name: City of Fortune
138509.description: City of Fortune is a combination of role selection and worker placement game with a hint of map building. Players take turns selecting roles and placing buildings to collect resources which can be used to gain points based on the roles that were selected. Roles change every round, so the game is constantly changing. There's very little luck involved, which makes this game a deep strategic masterpiece.

138510.name: Chōkūkan Night: Pro Yakyū King 2
138510.description:
User Summary

Chōkūkan Night: Pro Yakyū King 2 ("King Choukuukan Night Baseball 2" in English) is an anime-style baseball game featuring players from the Japanese professional baseball league. It was released only in Japan, and only for the N64.

138511.name: Bandit's End
138511.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bandits have raided a caravan and kidnapped the merchant's daughter! It is up to a brave band of heroes to track them down and bring her back safely. Unfortunately, the bandits may need to be saved as well!

Bandit's End is a low-level adventure based around a small dungeon infested by kobolds. The appendix contains a major artifact (open game content) for further stories.

138512.name: Blood Tomb
138512.description:
From publisher blurb:

Twenty-five years ago the lich Polivar the Bloodthirsty was sentenced to be sealed away forever for his crimes. With him was buried an artifact promising mortality. His tomb is about to be disturbed...

Blood Tomb is an introductory adventure involving battling river pirates, a trek across a marsh, and a lost tomb; all while being pursued by a wizard seeking the amulet the adventurers carry, an amulet leading to an artifact that several parties want.

The appendix contains an npc pirate class, as well as a minor artifact (both open game content).

138513.name: Fringe Races: Elves
138513.description:
From publisher blurb:


A Guide to Portraying Elves as Fey

In myth, legend, and faerie tale, elves were not just another race competing with humans for land, waging war against orcs, and joining reluctant halflings to destroy coveted artifacts. They were something else; they were fey.

If you have a desire to play a different type of elf, one closer to nature and further from humans, Fringe Races: Elves is what you?ve been waiting for! This book presents elves as fey and not as humanoids. While the book is compatible with elven material from other sourcebooks, and they aren?t so different from your d20 Elf to cause problems with your campaign setting, the elven material within will set them apart and return them to a more magical portrayal.

The PDF includes:

Four new elven races. Though the names might look familiar, the elves do not. The light elves are the knights of the fey. The dark elves are the anti-heroes that radiate fear. The gray elves are of mixed blood between the two. Half-elves are not half-breeds with human lineage, but shorter, mischievous elves.
A look at elven realms, culture, society, and courts based on the new races.
Three new classes just for elves. These classes are adaptations on three of the core classes, allowing the elves to progress as elves, and not a cultural variant of humans.
Elven meditation and what it unlocks.
Elven Masterwork weapons and armor.
Elf-shot.
8 new feats, 3 of which are supernatural.
9 new spells.
New animal companions and mounts. This section includes the faerie horse, faerie pony, faerie hound, reindeer, and flying reindeer.

138514.name: Prestige Class Anthology: Vol. 1
138514.description:
From publisher blurb:

What does the future hold for your characters? Are they spellcasters that seek to harness the powers of death, Or toy with darker forces, utilizing the powers of demons? Are they bloodthirsty warriors, or harbingers of the end of the world? Perhaps they seek to pass through others' dreams, or leave the Material Plane behind forever. That is but a taste of what awaits you...

This book contains all three of the Classes and all twenty-six Prestige Classes by Khan's Press between November 2002 to November 2003. They are from Tremon: Kingdom of Sorcery, Fringe Races: Rogues, Fringe Campaigns: Soul Harvest, the adventure Blood Tomb, and the free download Khan's Press Presents #1. None of the books mentioned are necessary to use this product. Additionally, all of the classes have been updated for the 3.5 edition.

This book also contains three feats, six spells, one domain, one creature template, one goddess, and information on a plane of existence.

138515.description: The first supplement for the Battlegroup game system, covering amphibious and airborne operations on D Day and the battles inland to the Westwall of Germany. Thirteen detailed army lists including German Panzer, Eratz Panzer, Falschirmjaeger, US and British Armoured, Infantry and Airborne divisions. Extensively researched background and comprehensive equipment data, including specialist equipment for amphibious assaults and 21st Panzer Division conversions. New scenarios and historical re-fights. This is a supplement to the Battlegroup Kursk ruleset.
138515.name: Battlegroup Overlord

138516.name: Night Terrors: Alien Parasite
138516.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are your friends acting strangely? Are arachnids crawling out of your slain foes? Do you hear voices?

From Khan's Press comes a book that's going to get under your skin. Alien parasites are small insect-like aberrations capable of full character development. Though small enough to squish, they seek out other creatures to crawl inside and possess.

Alien Parasites:

Possess other creatures, killing their minds and claiming the bodies.
Unlock new evolutionary abilities as they gain Hit Dice.
Progress with character levels.
Are fully useable by both Players and Game Masters!

138517.name: Celtic Tales: Balor of the Evil Eye
138517.description:
User Summary

In Celtic Tales: Balor of the Evil Eye, the player is the ruler of one of 18 tribes in Erie. The player is tasked by the goddess Danu with the goal of becoming the High King of Erie by uniting the tribes, either through military action or diplomacy, and leading them in battle against Balor, leader of the Fomors. The player leads a number of champions (and can recruit more champions as the opportunity arises) to a diverse range of tasks including improving and cultivating various provinces and engaging in a range of diplomatic and military actions. Certain champions have access to magic spells that provide a range of advantages (increasing the cow population, or providing more wood to chop down, as well as helping in combat). As champions act, they gain experience, improving their prowess, providing some RPG elements, as well.

138518.description:
2-6 player game, 15-20 minute game play. Players are the bosses of their families in the 1930s gangster era. Players hire thugs, bookies and torpedos to help them gain control of the various rackets in the city. Card play weakens/enhances family strengths during the game. The major twist is the HIT die, played during a racket round, where every character is a target!

Mature themes (nothing you couldn't read about in any Time-Life book from the library), recommended for 12+ years.

From the designer of Battle of the bands, Backstage Pass and Portable Adventures card games.

Players (families) battle each other to control a set number of rackets, 2 of one kind of racket or 3 of any kind racket. You build your family using thug, bookie and torpedo cards, collectively known as mug cards. Their point value is your power during rackets. When a racket card is being fought over, the players all roll a HIT die (1d6); any opponent mugs in play that match your die roll (a die is printed on the mug cards), those cards are either flipped-unusable during this round, or discarded. The die roll is then added to the remaining value of your mugs in play, highest score wins the contract. But, you must have a mug who can control that racket, otherwise it is discarded. Family cards are played during non racket rounds to help your family or hinder the opposition.
138518.name: King of Crime: Bootleg Edition

138519.name: The Potions Game
138519.description:
Players are student alchemists, taking turns exploring the academy grounds, obtaining ingredients to make potions. Ingredients come in five types, each type found in a different region of the board, or by drawing random cards.

Play consists of rolling a die to move a pawn around the board, collecting cards from certain spaces. Groups of cards allow you make potions. You need to collect enough potions to win the game, but using the potions during the game gives you powerful advantages.

138520.name: Leapfrog
138520.description:
Leapfrog is an alquerque-style game played on a square board of 97 spaces in a complex pattern. Each player has a Frog King and 8 Frog Pawns and the winner is the first player to get their Frog King to the central space.

Each player on their turn moves one piece a series of "leaps" — each leap being over exactly one occupied or unoccupied space. If the final leap is over a friendly piece then the player must immediately make another move with that piece. If the final leap is over an opponent's piece then the turn passes to that opponent who must make a move with that piece.

Leapfrog was published in issue 7 of the Games and Puzzles Journal.

138521.name: Das Bienenspiel
138521.description:
The game board represents a honeycomb in the bee hive. The queen rests in the middle of the brood nest (brown cells) surrounded by her royal household. The colored cells above the brood nest show stored pollen (inside the pollen field there are yellow and brown pollen cells).
Yet above the pollen field the honey cells are located (yellow cells). The honeycomb is occupied by the queen and several workers and drones. The smallest bees are workers.

In Das Bienenspiel players try to get 3 cards of honey and 3 cards of pollen. This is achieved by reaching either honey or pollen cells and claiming one. After each claim the player pawn has to return to the central brood nest unless he is able to hit a spot with a drone which allows the player to immediately turn around and go for another card.

Players have to move the full roll amount and must not enter cells which are occupied by bees or other player pawns.
Player with the full set of 6 cards (3+3) need to return to the queen cell to win the game.

138522.name: Rolly Boys
138522.description:
Objective: score most points hitting 'rolly boys' with a ball (skittle)
- acting by turns -
5 moveable (rotating) rolly boys (skittles), horizontally mounted on a staff, must be hit by a ball; flip the ball against a skittle (with values from 1 - 5) causing a rotation; achieved numbers should be summed up.
remarks:
typical design of wood working, located in the Erz mountains

138523.name: Ko-Scha
138523.description:
Objective: gain as many treasures as possible sailing in dangerous waters - game ends after all treasures are kept by players
- moving/acting by turns -
each player moves according die roll; if your ship enters the treasure island you may take a treasure - 1 or 2(max) of totally 13 - and sail home; but there are islands and shoals (light blue squares) which block or complicate (less freight) your way home.
You can get rid of your treasures passing an island, but you may load them onto your ship again with a matching die.

138526.name: Fürstlich Fürstenbergische Brauerei
138526.description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space
- moving by turns -
each player rolls the die moving forward; ending on a marked space follow instructions.
remarks:
simple "Roll & Move" game with educational elements (beer history)

138527.name: "Toste"-Spiel AHA
138527.description:
Objective: be the first forming the letters 'AHA' with 9 small coloured sticks
- acting by turns -
all players get 9 wooden sticks with the same colour each;
active player rolls the coloured die three times; if your own colour is shown add one stick forming the word 'AHA'. If you got that colour twice within a turn - remove all sticks and start again.
remarks:
should had been published before WWII; confusing cover shows two dice, but none of them - 6d6 & 6dsymbols - is used/added.

138528.name: Max und Moritz
138528.description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (80)
- moving by turns -
each player rolls the die, moving forward; ending on a marked space follow instructions, additionally read aloud text, originated from the book novelist Wilhelm Busch
remarks:
cute pewter figures
three different editions - 107, 107/1 and 107/2

138529.name: Flights of Fantasy
138529.description:
An LPS bonus mini-game.

"As the situation at Dien Bien Phu deteriorated, a relief plan was put into effect. Dubbed Operation Condor, WWII hero Colonel Boucher de Crevecoeur organized four battalions and 500 porters (PIMS) to march towards the beleaguered garrison..."
(From rules introduction)

Contents: One small mapsheet, one legal size cardstock sheet of rules, and a small sheet of 40 counters are included.

138530.name: Das lenkbare Luftschiff
138530.description:
Objective: be the first to reach target space
- moving by turns -
A roll-and-move race game portraying an airship journey combine with all possible incidents, even fire => quite impressive: drawing of a parachuter
Ending on (such a) marked space follow instructions.
remarks:
beautiful paintings, pewter figures, large board
should be published ~1910's

138531.name: The Tempest (Issue 1 - Feb 2004)
rpgissuearticle: Cupid's Bow: Weaponry of the Season
I Only Have Eyes For You...
138531.description:
From publisher blurb:

This February, Khan's Press kicks off its new quarterly magazine, TEMPEST. Each quarter will feature a "Storm" of new material that will be useful in nearly every d20 setting! Whether your gaming group plays high fantasy, gritty horror, medieval realism, or modern thrillers you will find something in the magazine to love. Every 3 months, we will be bringing you a selection of new feats, unique weapons, magic treasure, spells, monsters, dungeons, and/or alternate rules! Add something new to your game... In addition, each issue will contain fresh artwork, new fiction stories, interviews, and comic strips! The TEMPEST will make an enjoyable read even if your gaming group leaves you for a weekend in Vegas. Grab your copy of Tempest!!

Pick up this PDF and see how Khan's Press celebrates the darker side of the month of love... feats of love and vengeance and weapons that would make Cupid's job a lot more deadly! Plus, new fiction by Maggie McCall and Alexandra Ceelie, a preview of ElfClash: Realm of Lanai Player's Guide, and comic series by Chuck Whelon!

The TEMPEST Magazine will feature something for everyone! Pick up this first, reduced-price copy and see what the "Storm" brings in.

In this issue:

Dark Heart: Murrok's Tale (ElfClash Fiction by Maggie McCall)
Artist Profile of Sean V. Murray
Feats of Love and Vengeance (10 new feats)
Cupid's Bow: Weaponry of the Season (8 new exotic weapons)
ElfClash: realm of Lanai Freebies (Alternative spells for the Arcane Class)
I Only Have Eyes for You (fiction by alexandra Ceelie)
10 Deadliest Magic Items (10 new magic items)
Pewfell comic strip by Chuck Whelon
And more!!!

138532.name: Legends: Dice
138532.description:
This game is played with two deck of cards in where one is the dungeon the other is the village. With a bag of dice the player must roll the dice and with the result gain certain amount of mana,cash,attack,and shields. After the rolls the player must decide to visit de village or go down in the dungeon to fight a monster (classical fantasy dingeon game yes I know). The game ends when 5 Clock cards are out of the decks and the player with more Prestige points wins.

What makes this game unique is it exploits a dice pool of 21 dice and that the level system is based on a poker style achievements. You are allowed to carry 3 cards of each color.
Blue cards are Potions
Red cards are skills and spells
Green cards are Equipment
Yellow cards are Magical Time Artifacts (their power increases has the clock cards show up)

138534.name: Lustiges Reisespiel
138534.description:
Object of the game:
Be the first arriving at target space (Berlin/73)

Simple 'Roll and Move' game, learning the cities & places of interest of Germany before WWI. Ending on a marked space follow instructions glued on lid inside.
Equipped with pewter figures (cars) and cute drawings game communicates a special feeling of that age/time.

138535.name: The Tempest (Issue 2 - Apr 2004)
rpgissuearticle: Dark Heart: Murrock's Tale, Part II
Khan's Field Guide to Hell Hags
138535.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now available. Khan's Press's second installment of their new quarterly magazine, TEMPEST. Each quarter promises to feature a "Storm" of new material that will be useful in nearly every d20 setting! Whether your gaming group plays high fantasy, gritty horror, medieval realism, or modern thrillers you will find something in the magazine to love. Every 3 months, we will be bringing you a selection of new feats, unique weapons, magic treasure, spells, monsters, dungeons, and/or alternate rules! Add something new to your game... In addition, each issue will contain fresh artwork, new fiction stories, interviews, and comic strips! The TEMPEST will make an enjoyable read even if your gaming group plays a practical joke on you and hides from you for the weekend! Grab your copy of Tempest!!

Pick up this PDF and see how Khan's Press celebrates the chaos and elements of spring. The TEMPEST Magazine will feature something for everyone! Pick up this sophomore edition and see how much more we've crammed into the "Storm".

In this issue:

Dark Heart: Murrok's Tale part 2 (ElfClash Fiction by Maggie McCall)
Writer Profile of Garth Wright
Feats of Havoc (10 new feats)
Spells of Air (10 new spells for the arcane and the divine)
Dead of Night (fiction by Heather Murray)
Alternate Rules, Weapon Modifications, and ElfClash: Realm of Lanai Freebies
New Art, Humorous Items in the heart of April's Fools, another Pewfell comic strip by Chuck Whelon.

138536.name: Zunftblatt (Print Issue 3 - Sep 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Drachenlanze - Ein Klassiker im frischen Wind. Margaret Weis im Interview
Legendenreich I - Neuer Con mit Kultpotenzial in Kaiserslautern
Markus van Langen. Ein Interview mit dem "ewigen Spielmann"
Sookie Stackhouse - True Blood. Charlaine Harris im Gespräch
Theater der Vampire - Im Gespräch mit Mirko Schroeder
Vampire in der Welt von Warhammer Fantasy. Im Gespräch mit Steven Savile
[Die spitze Feder] Weichgespülte Nachtgestalten oder erotische Raubtiere
138536.description: The third print issue of Zunftblatt focuses on Vampires.

138537.name: Zunftblatt (Print Issue 4 - Nov 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Dan Abnett - Der Meister der Warhammer-Romane im Gespräch
Frost Zone - Die Quintessenz des Cyberpunk
Geheimbünde in der Geschichte der Menschheit
Känig der Raben. Die Legende von Robin Hood - Ein Gespräch mit Stephen Lawhead
Live Action Role Playing - Die Entwicklung realer Kompetenzen in virtuellen Welten
Mein Leben für das schwarze Kreuz
Mystic Path - Nebel um Burg Tiefenkaastel
Private Eye - Tod und andere Unannehmlichkeiten
Wohin mit Warhammer? Ross Watson über die Zukunft von Warhammer bei FFG
138537.description: Secret societies are the main topic in this issue.

138538.name: d20 Character Record Sheets
138538.description:
From the Back Cover
Just What You Need!
Chances are your character means more to you than some piece of scrap paper. So why do you keep you character information on a piece of paper that anyone else would think is trash? Treat that favorite character of yours the way you should with these sheets!

D20 Character Record Sheets includes...
...28 different record sheets that give you a place to record every bit of information you'll ever need to remember about your character and plenty of space to put those additional notes. Inside you'll find

A double-sided record sheet for every one of the eleven core classes.
A sheet to record all of that extra equipment, belongings, treasure and other booty you've accumulated through your adventures.
A sheet for your character's spellbook.
A character history sheet.
A sheet for significant NPCs or monsters.
An adventure log.




Tell Me About Your Character!
We're gamers. We all have facts and figures about our favorite characters memorized, but it's not official until it's on the character sheet. And what happens when gaming sessions begin to melt together? How are you going to keep everything straight in your mind? Don't worry. You've got all you need in your hands.

138539.name: Bull
138539.description: Much like Liar's Dice and other bluffing games, Bull uses 4 sets of cards numbered 1 to 11 as well as 4 Wild Cards and 2 "Bull" cards. Players play cards face down and make an annoucement concerning what those cards are. If someone challenges, then if the player was telling the truth, the challenger takes the cards. If not, the annoucing player keeps the cards. Scoring is based on the value of the cards players take and the lowest score wins.

138540.name: Tome of Artifacts: Eldritch Relics and Wonders
138540.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let the Wonders of the Ages Inspire You!

Few elements of fantasy roleplaying are as rife with possibility and potential as are artifacts, those ancient and unpredictable items of potent magics. Travel in quest of mystic wonders, stand as civilization's only defense against villains equipped with horrific powers, or challenge the gods themselves. Within these pages lie sufficient ideas to inspire dozens upon dozens of quests, adventures and even entire campaigns.

Magics Beyond Measure, Curses Beyond Comprehension

You hold in your hand a codex of almost limitless potential. Each and every artifact within contains not only a detailed description of its powers, but also a rich and inspiring mythology, adventure seeds, and the various consequences and downsides of use that make artifacts such a mixed blessing. Better yet, the Tome of Artifacts also contains new spells, new monsters, new feats, and a tool to aid you in creating your own artifacts, a random system capable of generating literally millions of unique artifacts!

138541.name: A Night in Seyvoth Manor
rpghonor: 2013 ENnie for Best Free Product - Nominee
138541.description:
designer summary

"A Night in Seyvoth Manor" is a "one shot" adventure for a group of between four and six 6th level characters, compatible with Dungeon and Dragons 4th Edition. It is made using some of the design concepts introduced in the "Fourthcore" line of products by SVD Press, but not as traumatizingly painful.

Nominated in the "Best Free Product" of the 2013 ENnie Awards.

138542.name: LEGO Chima CHI Battles
138542.description:
Set in the world of LEGO's Legends of Chima theme, the CHI Battles game system involves racing two LEGO vehicles — called "speedorz" — against one another to score "chi." If you win the dexterity part of a round, you then draw a card and select the attribute to use for attack. You can optionally spend one chi to add a sum to your score. Your competitor compares their score to yours and the winner claims two chi. The first player to reach six chi wins.

Different LEGO kits add different characters to the system, with their own speedorz, sets of character cards, and different buildable dexterity challenges.

138543.name: Birthright Conspectus
138543.description:
From the front cover:

Welcome to the world of Cerilia, home of the Birthright Campaign Setting for the Advanced Dungeons and Dragons Game.

You hold in your hand an overview of this land, its people, and its history. Open the conspectus to begin learning about the regal world of Birthright: For when greatness by right is thrust upon you, it is best to be ready.

User note:

This was a promotional poster designed to introduce the Birthright line, but it's actually a useful supplement in its own right, particularly for players. It summarizes the core concepts of Birthright, introduces most of the cultures, and unfolds into a 31.5" x 21.5" map of Cerilia.

138544.name: In The Club
138544.description:
Join the party with this tongue in cheek card game. Impress the ladies with crazy dances, exotic drinks and cheesy pick-up lines.

Players draw five "move" cards, a mixture of pick-up lines, dances, name-drops and outfits and cock-block cards. Then, players choose a location in the club to "make their move".

Locations include:
The Bar - players may exchange "move" cards for drink cards and play drink cards as well as other move cards.
The Dance Floor - players get a bonus to "dance moves" but cannot play name-drops or pick-up lines.
The VIP - players exchange a move card for entry, but receive a bonus for name drop cards. All other move cards can be played.
The Balcony - players get bonuses to pick-up lines and can play all other move types except dance moves.
The Bathroom - players can draw back up to 5 move cards.

The player who makes the best move, as scored by the total point value of all move cards made that round, impresses the lady that round. The next round, a new lady is eligible to impress, and the game continues until the lady total equals the winning total as determined by the number of players.

138545.name: Beasts, Men & Gods (2nd Edition)
138545.description:
The 2nd edition rulebook for the Beasts, Men & Gods RPG. After the game's 1st edition of 500 copies sold out, Bill Underwood revised the book and printed a 2nd edition of 1000 copies in 1982. Much later, Underwood revised the rules again and reformatted the text for a print-on-demand revised 2nd edition in 2011.

From the back of the rulebook:

"What is Beasts, Men & Gods?

"It is a dynamic system of combat that combines the facets of realism into a plausible and playable form.

"It is a unique magic system that allows diverse magicians and priests without hindering play.

"It is a solid form of Fantasy Role-Play that engages players' interests from beginning of play to the end of it.

"It's what you've been looking for to spice up your campaign."

138546.description:
Hythian is a new alien race for Among the Stars. It includes:

1x Hythian race tile
3x Hythian Power Reactors
1x Hythian Main Reactor (2 cards - 4 colors)

Hythian will be available exclusively through the BGG store.
138546.name: Among the Stars: Hythian

138547.description: Dixit Odyssey contains 84 cards for use in any of the Dixit standalone games. These cards – with artwork drawn by Pierô and colored by Marie Cardouat, artist of Dixit and Dixit 2 (a.k.a. Dixit Quest) – were originally included in the Dixit Odyssey standalone game released in 2011, but have since been repackaged as an expansion item that consists solely of cards and no other components.
138547.name: Dixit Odyssey (expansion)

138549.name: Pax East Wizard Duel
138549.description:
Wizard Duel is a card game being played at the 2013 Penny Arcade Expo East. Players join one of 3 schools and roam the convention looking for other wizards to duel, and fight with a deck containing Bolt, Burst and Shield spells.
When you meet a rival wizard, call out a gravitas-laden challenge that will shake the heavens with it's fury (but not too loud). Each wizard will then select a card from his or her deck and reveal them dramatically at the same time.

A Bolt is a quick spell that strikes first to defeat the more complex Blast.
A Blast effects a large area and will easily circumvent a Shield
A Shield spell creates a wall of force that can ward off any Bolt.

The wizard with the victorious spell is... victorious! If wizards cast the same spell, they strike each other in an explosion that would easily deplete any special effects budget. The wizards then pick a new spell and the duel continues until one is defeated.

The triumphant wizard claims all cards his or her opponent used in the duel. After Pax, the points are tallied and one school is crowned champion!

138552.name: Rolemaster Player Guide
138552.description:
From the back of the book:

This book contains everything a beginning Rolemaster player needs to know about how to play. This solves the problem of trying to introduce new players to Rolemaster, only to have them balk at the immense volume of information to absorb. In addition, veteran Rolemaster players will find the pre-generated character and summarized rules a great reference!

Here is what you will find inside:


A general overview of the Rolemaster system, everything that is needed for most decisions a player must make.
Eleven fully developed characters, with information for every single level from first to tenth (including special items gained and lost).
Attack tables for the player to use (along with the appropriate critical strike tables and fumble table.)
Spell lists, spell attack tables, spell critical tables, and spell failure table.
The General Static Maneuver Table and the Moving Maneuver Table.

138553.description:
From the publisher's website:

In the late 1920s, naval analyst and former spy Hector C. Bywater wrote what today would be called a "techno-thriller." His novel described a hypothetical conflict between Japan and the USA, set in his near future, 1931. His background in naval tactics, ship design, and history made him the perfect choice to write the story, and it proved to be wildly popular. In addition to being well-written and exciting, he described many advances in naval technology, such as the rise of naval aviation. But his story was also rooted in the past (including the use of poison gas), and concluded with a Jutland-style clash between the two great fleets.

Designer Bob Eldridge has transformed Bywater's novel into a gaming supplement of 30 scenarios for Command at Sea. Ship statistics include not only real-world units like the pre-war US and Japanese battleships, but also the ships that Mr. Bywater created for his story - the Alaska-class aircraft carriers and the Nagasaki-class supersubmarine. In addition he has included scenarios for another three campaigns, each determined by different historical events in 1926, 1932, and 1939. These also feature a mix of real-world and hypothetical units, like the US Lexington class, which were planned as battlecruisers until the Washington Naval Treaty.

Contents:

- 128-page booklet including 30 scenarios and stats, grouped in four separate campaigns.
- Two counter sheets of historical, hypothetical, and fictional units.


Not included but needed for play: Command at Sea 4th Edition Rules.
138553.name: Bywater's War: Command at Sea XI

138554.name: Adventure Fantasy Game (6th Revision)
138554.description:
User summary:

The core book of Paolo Greco's Adventure Fantasy Game system, an old-school-esque take on fantasy adventuring based on David Bowman's 5More design. Aside from rules for character creation, combat, adventuring and magic, the book also includes the adventure The Temple beneath the Harga Volcano.

Free pdf updates are available at www.adventurefantasygame.com

From the introduction:
This is another fantasy adventure game. Does the world need another one? Of course!
AFG exists to run fantasy sandboxes where players are free to get involved with exploration, traveling, politics,
dungeoneering, city-life and trading as much as they want. The rules aims are the following:
• Use only six-sided dice: grab a die and roll high.
• Rules simple enough to be taught and grasped in minutes, supporting pick-up play.
• Character creation should be quick and easy, not requiring to browse and pick options from a long list.
• Other games’ materials should be straight compatible or require small adaptations. You should be able to
run material from other games very easily.
• Minimum beancounting and fiddling. No experience points to track, interminable lists of character building
options. Modifiers, both in numbers and amounts, are small.
• Interesting choices must lead to important consequences.
• Rules must have a purpose and guide the narrative. Rewards must provide a clear direction for players: desired in-game actions must be rewarded by in-game rewards.

138555.name: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
138555.description:
User summary:

A compilation and minor reworking of the rules of the first edition of Advanced Dungeons & Dragons, made possible by the magic of the Open Game License. Finch, Marshall and company file of the copyrighted parts, reorganize the rules for easy reference, and add their own tone to one of the classics of roleplaying and in turn create one of the seminal works of the retroclone movement.

138556.name: Wir reisen nach Berlin
138556.description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (Berlin)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; you may choose (depending on the very first die roll) one of 3 different routes (car/Train/plane) to travel to Berlin; ending on a marked space follow instructions.

remarks:
very cost saving publication (1949!) => map, instructions, slipcase. Instructions reflect typical terms of that time/age like "Interzonen-food stamp" or "delousing"; incidents like 'carrying along a Westgerman newspaper - go back to...' describe daily encounters at the inner German border.
For the purposes of Berlin's 750 year celebration game was republished in 1987.

138557.name: Θησαυροκυνηγοί
138557.description:
Ancient ruins of a pyramid were discovered and Huey, Lewey and Dewey along with Dolly are on a mission to dicover the ancient artifacts! Can you help them achive their goal?

Players take turns rolling the dice and they enter the pyramid where they "dig" for treasures in each pile of tiles (using the little cuppings that come with the game) and they stop once they hit a dirt or a a minus tile. Once the pyramid is empty from all the tiles they head back to the finish line and the one with the most points win!

138558.name: Peril
138558.description:
A pseudo co-op game that secretly places one player against all their friends.

Much like fabled assassins of old, one player must bide time and patiently wait for the opportune moment to strike. But should your strike fail, or you wait too long, beware the others may notice and your life be now in danger. For the others, however, a perilous fight for survival while the assassin stalks the shadows and his identity remain unknown.

In PERIL, players play cards from their hand to either save or damage the turn player, secretly attempting to identify the assassin and destroy him before he destroys them. But be weary, who you destroy could be one of your own.

138559.description:
It is all going so well for you in Tahiti - sun and surf are yours to enjoy. The Director has not troubled you with silly assignments, such as escorting ill-mannered diplomats to parties; nor have you had to drop off intelligence in trash bins to be picked up by shady, desperate officials. You've made time to rest and do little other than drink martinis... Maybe you should hang up your hat and let someone else handle Dr. Lobo?

Alas, good things never last...

"Agent, you're going to Australia," the Director informs you. "As you are well aware, Australia has descended into corruption and chaos these past several years. You won't have time for barbies on the beach."

In Agents of SMERSH: Swagman's Hope, players have five new city locations to visit and a new book, featuring more than 300 encounters, with its own Reaction Sheet. Australia is the most dangerous country in the world, so why would important persons of intellect and power be trapped there? It is up to the players to come to their aid before SMERSH gets to them. Not only must players gain the normal Yellow Intel during the course of the game, but there are new Red Intel, representing scientists and researchers with vital knowledge for which Dr Lobo is hungry. Hurry to their aid before they get abducted and taken into the lawless Swagman's Hope where they may disappear forever. Swagman's Hope is a godforsaken, desert town in the middle of the Australian Outback - a dirty haven for the criminally insane and insanely criminal.

Also included in Agents of SMERSH: Swagman's Hope are new Villain, Fate and Status Cards, a new HENCHMAN, the Stranded Deck, Red Intel and Dead Drop Tokens, and 2 new UN agents to join in the hunt. Despite the town's name, hope is in short supply. Best of luck to you, Agent.
138559.name: Agents of SMERSH: Swagman's Hope
boardgamepodcastepisode: Agents of SMERSH vs. Tales of the Arabian Nights

138560.name: Il Domino Della Giornata
138560.description:
A language learning game, designed to study the conjugation of Italian verbs (both regular and irregular). With the 48 tiles the game tells the story of a day in the life of the Grilli family. Each tile has a picture on the left side and a text on the right side. In the text the verbs are all in the infinitive form, and have to be conjugated when the tile is played, but it can be checked in the instructions whether the correct form was used.
All the tiles are numbered. The game starts with the tile number 1 and based on the description tile number 2 needs to be found and so on.
The game can be played solo or in large groups (e.g. Italian classes).

138561.name: Think Before Asking
138561.description:
From the Cover:

The characters are in the Saturn system when Firewall contacts them. Another investigation has noticed something very unusual, a smuggled antimatter warhead with quantum entanglement control. Tracking the warhead leads to Phelan's Recourse and various subcultures, eventually pointing at a remote moonlet and its Brinker inhabitants. Arriving there the characters the chaotic remnants of an AI experiment gone wrong. A powerful seed AI is loose and the characters better figure it out before they accidentally unleash it across space.

user comment
there is no indication of when this created or published

138562.name: München
138562.description:
Quiz game about München (Munich) landmarks.

The board is a map of the city, with a track wandering through it. If a player is the first to land on one of the numbered spaces, he draws the card from the deck of 30 cards and reads out the information on the blue side of the card. Then he turns the card over to see what instructions he has to follow. This are fairly predictable; Miss a turn perhaps, roll the die and move backwards, and so on. The player then takes the card and keeps it in front of him where all the players can see it. The card will have a value ranging from 5 to 30, with the value being commensurate with the penalty value of the instruction on it. If a subsequent player lands on a numbered field that has already been taken, then he treats the space as a normal space without number.

When the numbered space 30 has been reached, that player has finished. The others play on. When all the players have reached the 30 space, the 'won' cards are added up and the winner is the one with the most points.

138563.name: Reise durch Oberbayern und Tirol
138563.description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 68
- moving by turns -
throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on a any image follow instructions glued on cover inside.

remarks: game belongs to the series: "Scholz' künstlerische Spiele" with very nice graphics/images;
as usual - cute pewter figures
seems to be the predecessor of Von München durch Oberbayern nach Tirol

138564.name: Spectrum
138564.description:
User summary:
Spectrum is an open source "universal story game system" that uses multiple sets of standard RPG dice (d4-d20) in several colors. A notable mechanism is that dice colors are associated with action types (skills/attributes). Players purchase dice and may upgrade them as their characters gain experience.

138565.name: Thurn and Taxis
138565.description:
User Summary

A computer version of the board game Thurn and Taxis developed by tdyck (Troy Dyck), available at
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/filepage/30655/thurn-and-taxis-...

138566.name: Blender Bros.
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
138566.description:
User Summary by zefquaavius

Blender Bros. is a side-scrolling platform game, in which you play the role of Blender, leader of the Cosmo Keepers. Blender has enormous, prehensile ears that he can use for all sorts of purposes, including attacking, climbing, performing high-reaching ear-spring jumps, and — amazingly enough — hearing: He can listen for Mini Bros. This is where the "Bros." part of the title comes in: As you start each level, you get to select any one of the (up to twenty) Mini Bros. you have gained so far in the game as your helper for the level. Each Mini Bro. conveys a different benefit, be it extending the reach of your attacks, healing, or something else entirely.

The game has kart-style racing vignettes between some of the normal level.

138567.name: Deadly 60 Tracker Board Game
138567.description: Track down the world's deadliest animals with the Deadly 60 Tracker Board Game. Based on the hit BBC TV show Deadly 60, you'll follow in Steve's footsteps on the trail of the planet's strongest, fastest and toothiest predators. Prowl around the board collecting equipment before heading to the centre for a time challenge - the first to find three deadly beasts wins. The Deadly 60 Tracker Board Game is suitable for two or more players aged eight and up.

138568.name: Delve Adventurer's Guide
138568.description:
From the publisher:
All of the Dungeon, None of the Map

Delve is an exciting new fantasy adventure game that's built on story-game principles but designed to emulate old-school dungeon crawling action. Delve's philosophy is that a dungeon isn't a place, it's a plot, and the rules provide a framework for unfolding exciting adventures without the frustrations of being bound to a piece of grid paper. No more hours of boring play due to your thief never being able to make a lock-picking check, or getting into arguments because someone put a hallway to the east instead of to the west: just push ahead, earn your Adventure Points, and find the quest at your own pace!

138569.name: Bomberman Tournament
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
138569.description:
User Summary by zefquaavius

In Bomberman Tournament, as with most modern Bomberman games, you will find a 1-player story mode, as well as a multiplayer game that is based on the classic Bomberman, blast-your-neighbors game. The story mode in this one is more in the vein of an 8-bit adventure/RPG.

138570.name: Dexter's Laboratory: Deesaster Strikes!
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
138570.description:
User Summary by zefquaavius

Dexter's Laboratory: Deesaster Strikes! As usual, Dee Dee has wandered into Dexter's lab, and is messing with his inventions. This time, she has made a bunch of little clones of herself — each one as blithely destructive as the original. You play the role of Dexter, and must round up all the Dee Dees from various parts of the lab, while fending off beasties, and repairing the equipment the Dee Dees have broken.

138571.description:
BGG Store Description
Give your adventurers some "character" with these stickers.
boardgameaccessory: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
138571.name: Escape: Adventurer Stickers

138572.name: Catcher Quartett
138572.description:
This card game is a traditional Quartett game using the picture cards but it also has a second game that uses the backs of the cards. This game is called Catcher Quartett and is only for two players.

Each card has a wrestling move on it.The four moves are Press, Pin, Drop Kick and Body Slam.

Each player is dealt half the deck. Both players choose a card secretly and then both cards are revealed simultaneously. If they are not the same, the following applies:

PRESS beats PIN
PIN beats BODY SLAM and DROP KICK
DROP KICK beats PRESS
BODY SLAM beats DROP KICK and PRESS

The strongest card takes the weaker card. Play continues until all the cards are used and the player with the most cards wins. If you want a longer game you can continue until one player has won all the cards.

138573.name: AceSaga
138573.description:
AceSaga, as the first project of MAIET Entertainment, has a characteristic of the strategic simulation focused on air combat. Especially, the game play developing from the 6 unique Commander Ships with distinct individualities is the unique feature that only AceSaga possesses.

-Appearance of total of 6 unique Commander Ships. Planning out strategy according to the Commander Ship!
-Speedy game play. Real time strategy with exceptional speed.
-Total of 45 campaign mode (29 senario modes, 16 training modes)
-Various difficulty setting and supporting Skirmish mode with background situation configuration option.
-Powerful scenario/map editor
-IPX, TCP/IP multiplay
-Full 3D camera control

Source: The Developer Website.

138574.description:
This is not a Memory game variation but it does require a good memory to win.

Each player takes a board on which there are a number of circles. Five of these circles show a Pancake Monster. Each player has a quantity of Pancake Tiles and these are placed on your board. The Pancake Monsters must be covered carefully so that the Monster cannot be seen.

in a turn, a player may lift up a Pancake Tile from the player on his left. If it does not reveal a Pancake Monster, the tile is taken and put on your own board. You may then continue your turn by taking a Pancake Tile from the board of the next player to your left. And so on, until a Pancake Monster is revealed. The tile must be replaced and the turn is over. Now the next player can play accordingly.

You need a good memory because it is bad to reveal a monster and as they get revealed and recovered, players should get some idea of which tile not to look under.

The first person to completely fill their board with Pancake Tiles, wins.
138574.name: Monster Memo

138575.name: Ye Olde Book of Spells
138575.description:
Designer's blurb:
Players always bogarting your copy of the rulebook to look up their spells? Hand 'em this little puppy instead! Compatible with any old school system involving stinky underground mazes and overgrown winged lizards. You know what I'm talking about.

User summary:
This is a spell reference covering first through third level spells for old-school class and level fantasy rpgs (early editions of D&D and retroclones).

138576.name: Book of the Divine
138576.description:
Designer's blurb:
Enhance your gaming table and give your players this book of divine spells for their Cleric or Druid characters. Compiled from the existing spell descriptions in the fantasy RPG Swords & Wizardry Core Rules and Supplemental Lore by Skathros. With a few modifications this book can be used with most old style fantasy RPGs.

User summary:
This is a handbook of cleric spells as presented in Swords & Wizardry and druid spells from Supplemental Lore.

138577.name: Honest Andy's Used Card Dealership
138577.description:
A short two player card game designed for 2013 Two-Player Print-and-Play Design Contest

Using 20 cards from a standard poker deck, players take turns trying to sell cards to each other and make a profit. The player selling can put lower value cards up for sale, but they run the risk of getting caught and losing their honest reputation.

Each player faces a small "Prisoner's Dilemma" choice each round. The player selling tries to guess what cards the other player is likely to buy. The player buying cards must decide if the other player is being honest or not.

138578.name: Silent But Deadly
138578.description:
In Silent But Deadly, there are 10 different types of fart cards in four various colors. Each fart card has a description of the fart card, like "Fluffy Poot", "Eggy Stinker", and "Floating Biscuits". Players discard a card in his/her hand by matching a fart type or by matching the color of the card played. The goal of the game is for a player to discard all of his/her cards.

Additional 'special play' cards include, "Light a Match", "Baked Beans", "Cabbage", and "Silent But Deadly". The Light a Match card negates these three specialty cards:
--Cabbage card requires a player to the left to pick up 1 card.
--Baked Beans requires the pick up of 2 cards.
--Silent But Deadly requires picking up 5 cards.

When a player is down to one card, he/she must announce, "low on gas" before the next player discards, else he/she is penalized and must draw 2 cards.

138579.name: Book of Wizardry
138579.description:
Designer's blurb:
Enhance you gaming table and give your players this hands on Spell Book for their Spell-casting characters. Compiled from the existing spell descriptions in the fantasy RPG Swords & Wizardry Core Rules. With a few modifications this book can be used with most old style fantasy RPGs.

User summary:
This is a handbook of wizard spells as presented in Swords & Wizardry.

138580.name: The Wiki Game
138580.description:
The Wiki Game is a hypertextual game designed to work specifically with Wikipedia. The Wiki Game (known casually as the "Wikipedia race") requires only a computer, Internet access, a web browser and a time-keeping device (optional) to play.
Contents

Objective

Players (one or more) start on the same randomly selected article and must navigate to another pre-selected article (home) only clicking links within the current article. The goal is to arrive at the home article in the fewest number of clicks (articles) or the least time. The single-player Wiki Game, known as Wikirace, Wikispeedia, WikiLadders, WikiClick, or WikiWhack, involves reducing one's previous time or number of clicks.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wikipedia:Wiki Game", available under the CC-BY-SA License.


The Wiki Game is folk game that is often used in schools as an educational tool.

138581.name: Im Märchenwald
138581.description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space 'E'
- simple 'Roll & Move' game/ moving by turns -
each player moves his/her meeple according die roll
ending on a numbered space follow instructions of the rule sheet

remarks:
unbalanced events
pretty the same sequence & events/board compared with Im Märchenland

138582.name: The Settlers Online: Castle Empire
videogamedeveloper: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
138582.description:
User Summary

The Settlers Online: Castle Empire is a browser based implementation of The Settlers gameplay, set in a world accessible to all through the web browser. Serfs carry out tasks according to the placement of building sites and resource availability and skirmishes may develop into devastating confrontations between nearby players.

138583.name: Das Kathreinerspiel
138583.description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 75 (die roll must match)
- moving by turns -
throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on a red marked space follow instructions printed on the map.

remarks:
simple 'Roll & Move' game, budget-friendly promotional edition (map only)
map measures: 15.65 x 10.2 inches
drawings convey a feeling about an outing during 1930's in Bavaria

138585.name: Crawl! (Issue 6 - Feb 2013)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
138585.description:
From the publisher:

Crawl! No.6: Classic Class Collection!

New classes for Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG as chosen by the DCC RPG community:

- The Talented Bard!
- The Tricky Gnome!
- The faithful Paladin!
- The survivalist Ranger!
- Plus a New Spell!
- and Custom Thieves!

138586.name: Assassin's Creed III: The Tyranny of King Washington – The Infamy
138586.description:
The Infamy is the first episode in the Tyranny of King Washington storyline. Following the revolution, Washington goes mad with power and rules as a tyrannical King. Connor awakes in this reality as Ratonhnhaké:ton - never having joined the Assassin order - and is greeted by his mother Kaniehtí:io, accepting a new mission to take down Washington. Acquire all-new skills to fend off this new threat to freedom. Live history as it never happened and ignite a new revolution!

Source: The Publisher Website.

138587.name: Assassin's Creed III: The Tyranny of King Washington – The Betrayal
138587.description:
The Betrayal is the 2nd episode in the Tyranny of King Washington, in which Washington goes mad with power and rules as tyrannical King. Connor awakes having never become an Assassin and accepts a new mission to fight for freedom. In this new episode, travel to Boston to find an unlikely but familiar ally in your war against the King - live history as it never happened and ignite a new revolution!

Source: The Game Website.

138588.name: Assassin's Creed III: The Tyranny of King Washington – The Redemption
138588.description:
User Summary

The Redemption is the final climactic episode of the Tyranny of King Washington series, the three part Assassin's Creed 3 DLC, in which George Washington goes mad with power and rules as a tyrannical King. In this final showdown, use your newest skills and abilities to take down King Washington, and win the fight for freedom. Live history as it never happened and ignite a new revolution!

boardgameintegration: Axis & Allies Air Force Miniatures: Angels 20
Axis & Allies Air Force Miniatures: Angels 20
138589.description:
Axis & Allies Air Force Miniatures is a fast, action-paced game of World War II air combat. Players take the stick of one or more of history's most famous warplanes, taking on their opponent in wild dogfights. Bandits High features aircraft used in the Pacific Theater of Operations and introduces new scenarios, including bombing missions!

Two-Player Starter Set includes six non-random warplanes, including the exclusive P-38J Lightning Ace, and everything needed to start dogfighting!

Booster Packs each contain three random warplanes, and there are 31 different planes for players to collect!

This is a game of aerial combat with WWII aircraft of various nations fought on a hexagonal map. This set represent aircraft primarily from the early years of the war. Players take turns determining initiative, moving their aircraft, and attacking opponents. Victory is determined player elimination or victory point total comparisons. Optional rules allow for clouds, flak fields, barrage balloons, and even night combat.

A&A Air Miniatures: Bandits High details:

- Set contains legendary aircraft like the Ju 87 Stuka, Navy F4U Corsair, P-51D Mustang, and IL-2 Sturmovik.
- Prepainted, durable plastic—assembled and ready to play, right out of the box.
- Abilities and statistics of units based on historical performance in battle.
138589.name: Axis & Allies Air Force Miniatures: Bandits High

138590.name: The Keepers of Lingusia
138590.description:
Back cover blurb:
Old School Swords & Sorcery Adventure in the World of Lingusia

A classic campaign setting, built on 30 years of adventuring in old school game systems, written and presented for use with modern retro-clones under the OGL 1.0a.

New Classes, monsters, kingdoms of adventure, hand-rendered old-school style maps, tons of adventure ideas, a complete pantheon of gods...

Battle for Glory in the Hyrkanian Empire...
Liberate Octzel from ancient evils...
Quest for lost kingdoms in Amech...
Discover the ruins of Corti'Zhan, city of gods...

Publisher's blurb:
The Keepers of Lingusia: A classic Old School campaign setting released under Open Game License 1.0a and designed specifically for use with Old School retrogames (and Castles & Crusades in particular). Includes classes, monsters, gods, kingdoms of adventure and many, many hand-rendered Very Very Old School style maps. For gaming the way it was! Requires an Old School rule system to play (specifically designed for Castles & Crusades by Troll Lords Publishing but also easily converted for use with OSRIC, Labyrinth Lord, Legends of the Flame Princess, Dark Dungeons, and Swords & Wizardry, among others)
From the overview:
The World of Lingusia is an immense realm, a legendary planet forged at the moment of creation by great, primal beings. Its history is one of perpetual discovery, magic, danger, and conflict. It is, in short, ideally suited for tales of high adventure, intrigue, and exploration.

User comment:
This setting is based on Tori Bergquist's personal campaign setting and there are support materials (maps and campaign notebooks) available for download. The setting has developed over thirty years of gaming and has been used with several rules systems during that time: Dungeons & Dragons, Dragonquest, Runequest, GURPS, C&C and T&T. The current, published form of the setting is designed for use with C&C. There are setting locations suggested for several TSR-era adventure modules.

The setting book features a section of house rules that have a distinct old-school flavour, the house rules section (for C&C) is also available separately.

138591.name: LEGO City Undercover: The Chase Begins
138591.description:
"Lego City Undercover: The Chase Begins is an upcoming prequel sandbox-style action-adventure video game, currently in development by TT Fusion, a division of TT Games, that will be released on the Nintendo 3DS on April 21, 2013. Unlike previous Lego titles developed by TT Games, which have been based on various licenses, the game is based on the Lego City brand and will be published by Nintendo. It is the second Lego game to be published by Nintendo rather than an independent publisher such as WB Games or LucasArts.

Gameplay

Lego City Undercover: The Chase Begins is a City-themed video game set for release on the Nintendo 3DS on April 21, 2013. The game is a prequel to the Wii U title, Lego City Undercover, and follows the adventures of Chase McCain as a rookie cop.

Development

LEGO City Undercover: The Chase Begins was first announced during Nintendo's press conference at E3 2011 on 7 June 2011 with the tentative name LEGO City Stories. On 17 January 2013 the 3DS game was revealed to have had a name change to LEGO City Undercover: The Chase Begins"

Source: Wikipedia, "Lego City Undercover: The Chase Begins", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

138592.description:
Box Translation
Collector's and Duelist alike can find the following in each DX Version of the Duel Disk
(1) Yusei Fudo Version Duel Disk
(10) Assorted Booster Packs (x1 ABPF, x3 YUSEI DP2, x3 SOVR, x3 ANPR)

The Duel Disk itself has become highly desirable since the Japanese version is battery operated and lights up! Monster Fields also feature Pop-Up Action!

User Input
The Limited edition comes with the above, plus:
1 x Pack of 100 Card Protectors (Gold)
DDY2-JP001 Junk Collector 「ジャンク・コレクター」 (Secret Rare)
DDY2-JP002 Backup Warrior 「バックアップ・ウォリアー」 (Secret Rare)
DDY2-JP003 Miracle's Wake 「奇跡の残照」 (Secret Rare)
DDY2-JP004 Starlight Road 「スターライト・ロード」 (Secret Rare)
138592.name: Duel Disk: Yusei Fudo Version

138593.name: Quann'Ra-Tioll Moorchlyne's Most Excellent Compilation of All the Realms Known Ioun Stones
138593.description:
Publisher's blurb:
This compilation contains more than 600 Ioun stones to brighten up your campaign.

User comment:
An illustrated compendium detailing hundreds of ioun stones and information about the fictional origins and further development by the author. The author's afterword references several sources of inspiration in literature and gaming, and gives some historical context with reference to publications and people who have done similar work.

boardgameintegration: Charades In-A-Box: American
Charades In-A-Box: Canadian
Charades In-A-Box: Celebrity
Charades In-A-Box: Rock and Roll
Charades In-A-Box: American
Charades In-A-Box: Canadian
Charades In-A-Box: Celebrity
Charades In-A-Box: Rock and Roll
138594.description:
Family Charades In A Box Compendium is a party and family game of acting out. Six themes of Charades are included in one box. Themes include: Hollywood Charades, Animal Party, Time Capsule, Family Charades, Kids Charades, and Picture Charades (which requires no reading). The goal of the game is to be the first team to win the most points at the end of 12 rounds by correctly guessing the Charade(s).

The Second Edition print of Family Charades In A Box Compendium was manufactured in the United States. Components include six card decks, a sand-timer and a spinner. Each card has three Charades. The spinner determines which Charades the TEAM will act out. Choices on the spinner include acting out one of the three Charades on the card, the OTHER TEAM picking which Charade should be acted out, the TEAM chooses which Charade to act out or all three Charades must be acted out.

Rules include a signal sheet to help players act out the Charade.
138594.name: Family Charades In A Box Compendium

138595.name: Reign of Winter
138595.description:
The mysterious magic of the North is yours to claim in this treasury of arctic arcana. Among these chilling curiosities wait the most important items from the Reign of Winter Adventure Path. Each of this set’s 54 beautifully illustrated, full-color cards includes space on the back to add notes for each item, allowing players to track their favorite treasures.

These item cards are designed for use with the Reign of Winter Adventure Path, but are useable with any fantasy roleplaying game.

Pathfinder Item Cards allow heroes to keep track of their equipment in style. Each full-color card features a beautiful portrait of an item on one side with blank space on the back to keep notes. Pathfinder Item Cards are compatible with any fantasy roleplaying game.
From the Publisher Blurb

138596.name: Mini Games: Casino
138596.description:
From Introduction:


Welcome to the d20 Guide to Casino Action!

There is just something about the floor of a casino, a feeling of electricity in the air. Cheers at the craps table, the clink of coins dropping from slot machines, the scream of cheaters having their hands broken ... yes, there’s something for everyone inside a casino.

This book is a guide to the most popular modern casino games to spice up your d20 campaign, whether you are playing in the fantasy genre or contemporary times. The rules are broken into two sets: abstract and detailed, depending on how detailed you would like to roleplay character time at the tables. The abstract rules are meant for simulating long stretches of casino game play, such as a character spending an evening at a poker table. The detailed rules are for when you want to play out every play – or at least the ones that matter.

The book is rounded out with a few extra casino tidbits, such as how casinos deal with cheaters in a magical world and new feats for dedicated character gamblers.

138597.name: Gazala
138597.description:
Gazala is a low complexity wargame on the Battle of Gazala. The game can be played either solitaire or two player.

Each player has an objective that he or she must meet in order to win - either number of units destroyed or occupying certain hexes. Each counter can move one hex per turn. The combat is a simple system in which the players must roll greater than or equal to the number printed on the counter to achieve a hit.

The rules are only three pages long. The game also includes a counter sheet and a map that can be printed at 11x17 (A3) or 8.5x11 (A4).

138598.description:
2nd El Alemein is a low complexity wargame on the Second Battle of El Alamein. The game can be played either solitaire or two player.

Each player has an objective that he or she must meet in order to win - either number of units destroyed or occupying certain hexes. Each counter can move one hex per turn. The combat is a simple system in which the players must roll greater than or equal to the number printed on the counter to achieve a hit.

The rules are only three pages long. The game also includes a counter sheet and a map that can be printed at 11x17 (A3) or 8.5x11 (A4).
138598.name: 2nd El Alemein

138600.name: Shattered Star
138600.description:
From the back of the box:

Give life to your NPCs with the Shattered Star Face Cards! More than 50 key characters fill this gorgeously illustrated deck designed for use with the Shattered Star Adventure Path, but suitable for use in any fantasy roleplaying game! Each card includes the character’s name, his or her role in the Shattered Star Adventure Path, space to record key details, and artwork by Paizo’s finest illustrators. These Face Cards bring the most prominent cast members of this lethal Adventure Path to your tabletop and let your players look into the faces of the enemy!

138601.name: The Guard
138601.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all who learn the arts of combat seek to use them.

In civilized lands, where people might live their entire lives without once coming under the threat of the blade or the claw, there are still many reasons people study the martial arts. Wether it be as a deterant against conflict; or protection from war, theft or crime; or for the purpose of detection and detention of criminals, many jobs exist for the strong, intimidating or dangerous who do not choose to seek out trouble for themselves.

The Guard is a class enabled for conflict, but for those individuals who seek a more ordinary life.

138602.name: The Mystic
138602.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you choose what god to worship.
Sometimes, the god chooses you.

For reasons unknown to mortals, some few people do not ask, and yet attract the attention of the divine. They are granted abilities the likes of which even the most faithful of priests cannot match. Labeled as witches, or diabolists, or even occasionally as prophets, they are often outcast by normal society and religions. For, after all, what could be more dangerous than someone blessed of the gods, yet not conforming to the established order or faith?

In extreme cases, Powers have been known to invest in the most unlikely of people. A Paladin might awaken to discover abilities granted by the gods of Rot, or an Assassin to find the healing touch gifted by the lords of Order. Though the purpose of this gifting is beyond the ken of the receiver, the Powers always move to a greater, unfathomed purpose.

These gifted, or cursed, are The Mystics.

138603.name: The Professional
138603.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are many occupations that need a skilled hand, a keen eye, and a quick mind. The middle classes of the world are made up of experts with varying degrees of skill, plying their trade and earning an honest living. Some skills are so well regarded and paid that there are never any shortages of apprentices, and the greatest of artisans gain such stature and renown as to be figures of note throughout the lands.

Among them, some gifted individuals speak of times when there is almost a melding of mind and body, where they seem to enter a Zone where every action is precise, every perception accurate and the greatest acts of skill can be wrought.

Be that as it may, sometimes trouble comes uncalled even into the most secure of dwelling and civilized city. And even the most devoted of workers may then have need of more than their craft to survive.

The talented experts of the world are Professionals.

138604.name: The Scholar
138604.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some people have no interest in the practical.

There are those that devote themselves to esoteric knowledge, theory, history and art. If given the opportunity, they might be eternal students and teachers, ever learning new and unusual things. Their devotion matches that of the Monk or the Wizard, but has a far less useful application. Long nights, poor care for their material concerns, these things make them as physically weak as the Wizard, without the advantage of magic to buoy them up. Absent minded, and focused upon their own interests, they are often seen as eccentric. They can achieve wide renown for their sagacity, as courtiers or advisors.

They are the least physically and magically equipped of any Unlikely Hero to manage in a time of crisis. But they do have a power of their own, though it be abstract and less applicable than those of others. It is the power of knowledge.

The sagely and well read of the world are Scholars.

138605.name: Deep Dwarven Delve
138605.description:
From publisher blurb:

This module has lain unseen and forgotten in the TSR design vault for twenty years. Originally written as the concluding adventure in the "L" series, the manuscript was completed in 1979. As a part of the celebration of the Silver Anniversary of the Dungeons & Dragons game, we've unearthed this classic adventure and present it here for the very first time - the last first Edition AD&D Module ever to be published!

Your party of stalwart heroes must venture into a lost dwarven mining complex, fighting terrible monsters, bypassing deadly traps, and exploring chambers heavy with the dust of ages. Somewhere deep below the surface lies the heart of darkness - a corrupting evil that must be stopped before its influence can spread!
An adventure for characters levels 3-6.

138607.name: Malifaux: Lucius Crew
138607.description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

Lucius is tricky. His crew generally consists of lower cost models such as the Guild Guards. Even his "heavy hitters" do not pump out a lot of damage on their own, but rely on a combined arms approach. He, of everyone in the Guild, supports his crew the most and loses well over half of his capability when not running his own crew. His limited crew of Guardsmen and Elite Division can pull off some cool "alpha strike" tactics, but it's pretty tricky to make them work. Focusing on any single part of his crew can take it apart quickly and make it tougher to play.

Overall, Lucius crew is all about the whole being greater than the sum of it's parts. For the most part your crew will be made of very "average" models (average movement, average attack, average resilience), but can be made to work very well by using a combined arms approach.

The Elite Division box comes with 1 Guild Guard (4 SS), Ryle (8 SS), the Guild Guard Captain (7 SS) and a Lawyer (7 SS), for a total of 26 Soulstones (plus Lucius' cost of 10 SS if not leading the crew). The starter box thus gives you a very top-heavy crew, with a trio of high-cost minions. Lucius tends to work best when he has a good number of minions around him however, so your first purchases should definitely be cheaper models with which to replace one of the 7-8SS minions in small games.

Your first purchase after the starter box should definitely be a pack of Guild Guard, who are cheap, resiliant and decent in both melee and ranged combat. Adding at least one Austringer is recommended to begin with. Good early buys are a blister of Guild Guard, a second Austringer and one of the Totems. Which one you choose depends on your play style, but if in doubt the Drill Sergeant has several different uses.

Lucius is trickier than a normal Guild Master due to his reduced list options, but can do well if you use the right pieces at the right time.

138608.name: Malifaux: Exorcist
138608.description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

The Exorcist is a minion for the Guild.

With a walk of 3” and no charge the Exorcist is one of the slowest Guild models. To get around this the Exorcist has a zero action Driven by Purpose which makes the model suffer one wound and pushes it 3”.

With only 7 wounds and a lack of healing in the Guild Faction, the Exorcist will not make much use of this action but it is useful for positioning him or pushing him out of melee range.

The Exorcist is armed with a Sanctified Crossbow. This weapon has range of 10” and is Magical. Like most Guild models it has Critical Strike built in, giving the weapon a nice damage profile of 3/4/5 with the abilities to get to 4/5/6. With a CB of 5 the Exorcist is likely to hit most minions.

The Exorcist enables Lady Justice to deal full damage against Spirits by granting her already impressive Greatsword Magical. Combined with that and Blind Justice to ignore Pitiful and Harmless, she can shore up her weakness against Kirai with this minion.

138609.name: Malifaux: Scales of Justice
138609.description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

Scales of Justice is a Totem for Lady Justice. He is on the average scale for a lot of its stats.

The part where the Scales shine brightest though, is its Tip the Scales spell. It requires a high card, but it can be any suit, and if cast, can inflict a positive, or negative twist on its target during its next duel. The opponent can resist it, but if you manage to cast it, it can set up a huge power play. Or, cast it on a friendly target, and give it a better chance at fighting, or resisting a spell.

The Scales also have one (0) action, that allows you to cycle your hand, one card at a time. Use it to get rid of any low cards you might not want, and draw a new one.

138610.name: Malifaux: Guild Austringer
138610.description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

He's a guy with a bird. How scary can that be? The answer, apparently, is "very scary." With a very long range and the ability to ignore Line of Sight, the Austringer has quickly become a premier Guild Minion.
