Prevent the Sneaky Con Artists from running away with all the money before the glorious Space Colony Hex is finished and stop the money-hungry Government Agents from bloating up the blueprints and making our sleek new Space Colony break the bank. Start scheming for Space Colony Hex's glorious completion or utter demise!

Space Colony Hex is a quick, tile-placement game with hidden teams. Players add tiles to the blueprint, bump other tiles off, and steal tiles from one another to achieve their hidden, sometimes shared, objective. The unique objectives will lead players to create makeshift alliances one minute then turn on each other the next. The ever changing blueprints will keep players on their toes looking for an opening to make the perfect move.

138807.name: Sehen und Begreifen
138807.description:
'Look and Learn' (English name) is designed to stimulate a child's ability to "discriminate between objects, to compare them, to grasp relationships between them, and to sort according to common characteristics." (From the box bottom.)

Up to seven different games are possible using the multi-picture boards and picture tiles included. Three of them are described here:

1. Picture lotto
Each player gets a player board. Boards that aren't needed and the corresponding tiles are removed from the game. The remaining tiles are shuffled and placed on the table, colour side up. The game master picks up one tile after the other, shows the picture and names the pictured object. The player whose board contains the same picture calls out, gets the tile and places it on his/her board. The first player to have covered all the images on his/her board wins the game.

2. Picture quiz
The game master shows a picture without naming it. The player who has the picture on his/her board calls out, but they only get the tile if they can name the object. The opposite way is possible too: The game master doesn't show the picture but names the object shown on the tile. The player who finds the picture on his/her board gets the tile. The first player to have covered all the images on his/her board wins the game.

3. Memory lotto
Each player gets a board. He/she gets 30 seconds to memorise the images. Then the player boards are placed on the table, face down. The game master picks up one tile after the other and shows the image or names the object. The player who thinks the image is on his/her own player board calls out. The tile is placed face up next to the player board. If two players call out simultaneously, the game master puts the tile at the bottom of his/her stack. If an image isn't claimed by any of the players, the tile is removed from the game. When the game master has used all the tiles, the players reveal their boards. For each matching tile, they get two points; for each incorrect or missing one, one point is subtracted. The player with the most points wins the game.

More game variations are possible using the different colors on the backs of the picture tiles and multi-picture boards.

The box indicates that it was "Made in Western-Germany".

138808.name: Franchise
138808.description:
The object of the game is to become the wealthiest player by the buying and licensing of franchises. Genuine franchise companies are used in the game, such as Shakey's Pizza, Robo Car Wash, Wiener King, Lawn Doctor, Natural Cosmetics, and several others.

Each player starts with $110,000. Players roll dice and move their pawns around the board, and may purchase the franchise system depicted on the space they land on, if it is currently unowned. If another player lands on the same space, he must become a franchisee, and pays the system owner a royalty fee whenever he again lands on that space. Only two franchises of any type may be sold, so anyone else landing on that space becomes a customer and must pay a fee based on the number of franchises owned. Players may freely buy and trade franchises between themselves.

If a player cannot pay the required fee(s), he is declared bankrupt and is out of the game.

138809.name: Clinical Anatomy
138809.description:
"Clinical Anatomy is an incredible study aid that plays like a game! Memorize and learn the name, location and function of more than 600 muscles, 206 bones, nearly 60 organs, 150 named nerves and 150 named blood vessels, and dozens of joints in the human body." (From the website.)

Gameplay is nearly identical to Trivial Pursuit. Players start with their token on any spot on the board. Dice are rolled to move the tokens around the board, and the players answer questions based on the subject their token lands on, such as "GA101" (General Anatomy 101), "GA102", "Cadaver Lab", and "Potluck". Correct answers garner the player an individual letter to add to their collection. The first player to collect enough letters to spell "clinical anatomy" is the winner.

138810.name: Monopoly: Offenburg
138810.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Offenburg, a city located in Germany.

138811.name: Monopoly: Föhr
138811.description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Föhr, a North Frisian Island in Germany.

138812.name: Minden Professional Volleyball
138812.description:
This designer has always been a little quirky (he is a friend so he won't mind me saying it) and he deveoped his various skills at making a statistical game that was unusual, this game.

As usual with these games, there are numerous charts and tables enabling you to replay Pro Volleyball matches. I believe the pro league did really exist, in Canada.

138813.name: Minden World Cup Football
138813.description:
The designer adapted his tried and trusted his soccer game rules and researched statistics for every world cup team from 1930 to 1983.

As usual with statistical games, you throw dice and check the roll or rolls against various charts and tables. It is fairly quick to play and allows a complete World Cup competition to be replayed in an evening.

138814.name: The Reign of Men
138814.description:
From the publisher's website:
“If we only contemplate on what we are, we will never see what we may become. Philosophy is the beginning of action, not the whole of it.”

— Valir Severin, The Philosophies

Wicked Fantasy began as a series of articles in Kobold Quarterly Magazine reinventing the “standard races” in fantasy roleplaying. Now, those same articles have been expanded and revised (five times their original size!) and fit with the PATHFINDER Roleplaying Game.

The first in the series–The Reign of Men–tackles the most generic, most boring, most overlooked race in fantasy literature: humans!

No longer the “generic race,” humans are the center of learning, culture and democracy.

Humans are bound not by a common faith, but by a common philosophy: that all men may become more than they are. They do this through rigorous training, insight and learning. The Reign of Men builds schools and universities to bring wisdom and enlightenment to all men and women.

While other races seek knowledge and power from external entities, humanity looks for power from within. Will, self-determination and dignity are the virtues of men and these virtues provide them with powers the other races can only describe as “magical.” But men would claim these abilities are the exact opposite of magic; instead, the abilities taught to children in human schools and universities only tap into latent power within the human spirit.

Wicked Fantasy: The Reign of Men includes:


FULL COLOR AND FULLY ILLUSTRATED!
New Human Racial Traits
New Feats including Teamwork Feats, Knowledge Feats and Rally Feats
New Cleric Archetype: The Philosopher
New Paladin Archetype: The Palatine
Philosophy and Humanity Domains

138815.name: Children of Pain
138815.description:
From the publisher's website:
Come closer to the fire, child. Come closer, listen and I will tell you how we murdered the gods…

Wicked Fantasy began as a series of articles in Kobold Quarterly Magazine reinventing the “standard races” in fantasy roleplaying. Now, those same articles have been expanded and revised (five times their original size!) and fit with the PATHFINDER Roleplaying Game.

The second in the series–Children of Pain–tackles the most set upon, abused and misunderstood race in all of fantasy literature: the orks.

Created for lives of evil, orks rose up and overthrew their gods. Now, they battle against what they were so they may forge their own destinies.

No longer the “standard evil race,” orks have become something more. Taught that all life was pain and that only pain makes an ork great, they have embraced that philosophy, while at the same time, turning it into something greater. They are no longer the slaves of dark gods. They are orks. Free to choose. Free to make the world into a better place… or rend it to shreds with their bloodlust and rage.

Wicked Fantasy: Children of Pain includes:


FULL COLOR AND FULLY ILLUSTRATED!
New Ork Racial Traits
New Feats including Masochistic Feats and Reputation Feats
New Oracle Archetype: The Oracle of Blood
New Barbarian Archetype: The Gahthrak (God Eater)
New Bard Archetype: The Fala
Ork Blooding Rituals

138816.name: Minden Replay Baseball
138816.description:
The designer is most noted for his statistical games that create games for sports not usually depicted in such games. Britain hardly ever developed stats games up to 1980 or so, and Gary filled the gap in the market by making games for Cricket and Soccer. However he must have felt that he had to make at least one American staple and so he published this.

As usual with statistical games, all you need are two dice and all the charts and tables provided within the game. Thus you can try to replay a whole season (if you fancy playing over 1,000 games!)

138817.name: Seeming Servants
138817.description:
From the publisher's website:
Young Marie Tonsen yawned as she stepped into the kitchen for a midnight drink of water.What she saw was little Weatherby, the family haffun butler, covered in blood, standing over a dead body who looked like he might be some kind of burglar.

“Mister Weatherby?” the girl asked.

Weatherby smiled. “It’s a nightmare, child. Go back to sleep.”

Wicked Fantasy began as a series of articles in Kobold Quarterly Magazine reinventing the “standard races” in fantasy roleplaying. Now, those same articles have been expanded and revised (five times their original size!) and fit with the PATHFINDER Roleplaying Game.

Viewed by humans as harmless servants, the “haffun” race integrated itself into their society seemlessly. They are gardners and butchers and maids and butlers. But the haffuns hold a secret that hardly any human even suspects, and it isn’t just that they guard humans while they sleep. There is a deeper horror in the world. And haffuns know its name…

The third race in the Wicked Fantasy series–Seeming Servants–tackles the… well… John’s least favorite race in all of fantasy literature: the halfling

While they appear to be peaceful gardners (with a slight addiction to “pipe weed”), haffuns are a race with a thouand secrets… and a sacred oath to keep them at any cost.

Wicked Fantasy: Seeming Servants includes:


FULL COLOR AND FULLY ILLUSTRATED!
New Haffun Racial Traits
New Feats including Family Feats and Talda (stealth) Feats
New Oracle Archetype: The Ghostspeaker
New Haffun Only Core Class: “The Bulter”
A New “Haffun Family” System that allows players to build their own Haffun Families
The Great Secret the Haffuns are keeping from Humanity!

138818.name: For the Pack
138818.description:
From the publisher's website:
This wretched, disease-carrying creature is the result of the mating of a gnome and a troll. Its skin is infected with fungus and its hair is always matted, thick with its own filth.

It is a cowardly, carrion creature that feeds on the kills of others. Its heart is devoid of heroism, preferring to attack lone individuals in groups, using superior numbers to compensate for its weaknesses. Their deformity—with short legs and long arms—is an outward indication of inner corruption.

These scavenging disease-bringers deserve nothing more than our complete contempt. I hereby advise His Highness that if his guards come across these worthless things that they be killed, then burned to prevent the spread of their foulness.

—Alvador Stime, High Scholar for the King of Men, Edward Dunzny

Wicked Fantasy began as a series of articles in Kobold Quarterly Magazine reinventing the “standard races” in fantasy roleplaying. Now, those same articles have been expanded and revised (five times their original size!) and fit with the PATHFINDER Roleplaying Game.

They are not the result of the mating of a gnome and a troll. Anyone who looks at one could figure that out in five seconds. They look nothing like trolls nor do they bear any resemblance to gnomes. A gnoll looks more like a hyena standing upright.

And gnolls do not call themselves gnolls. That word was invented by the aforementioned scholar and stuck in the human language ever since. “Gnolls” call themselves the dach’youn. It means, “we the trodden.” (The less formal name is dach.) The name does give them a sense of self-awareness, but not as one might think. It is not a title of self-pity, but only a realistic understanding of their place in the world.

The fourth in the series–For the Pack–tackles one of the most misunderstood races in all of fantasy literature: gnolls.

Disregarded as simple pack animals, the dach’youn have long been seen as simple pack animals, but there is so much more to their culture than men suspect. In fact, gnolls know secrets men may never discover.

Wicked Fantasy: Gnolls: For the Pack includes:

FULL COLOR AND FULLY ILLUSTRATED!
New Gnoll Racial Traits
New Pack Rules, making gnolls a deadly force when working together
SIX NEW ARCHTEYPES! All designed to work within the pack
New Feats including pack feats and moon feats
Moon Magic and a calendar that tracks the Known World’s seven moons
And More!

138819.name: Guardians of the Wood
138819.description:
From the publisher's website:
Man’s first encounter with the elves was the source of what historians would later call “the Great Forest Wars.” Lumber was essential to building the Kingdom of Men and when they reached the deep forests of the world, they found the elves waiting for them.

The Wars lasted an entire generation but eventually ended with the elves seeking peace.

They gave no mention as to why, but one hundred years later, their secret was out.

The elves were losing their souls.
—Donnington True, The History of the War of the Kingdoms

In the Known World, no story is more tragic than the Fall of the Elves. Once a great and powerful race, the elves have fallen into decadence and indulgence. But the key to their downfall was not their nature, it was mankind’s discovery of the Iron Curse…

Wicked Fantasy began as a series of articles in Kobold Quarterly Magazine reinventing the “standard races” in fantasy roleplaying. Now, those same articles have been expanded and revised (five times their original size!) and fit with the PATHFINDER Roleplaying Game.

The fifth in the series–Guardians of the Wood–reveals the great and terrible story of the elves. How they rose to power, how they fell and how they may be redeemed.

Wicked Fantasy: Elves: Guardians of the Wood includes:

FULL COLOR AND FULLY ILLUSTRATED!
New Elf Racial Traits including the Tree-bound elf, the Iron-bound elf, and half-elves!
The terrible secret of the Iron Curse and the ever-present shadow of the Dark Elves!
New Archetypes including the elven druid, sorcerer, witch and summoner!
A New Prestige Class: the Heart-Bound!
New Feats and New Rules for Forest Favors!
And More!

138820.name: Scourge of the City
138820.description:
From the publisher's website:
The rats? Why complain? What good will it do? What are you gonna do about them? One day, there was nothing, and the next, they were everywhere. Wasn’t like they crept up on us.

It was the plague. That’s what it was. Hit every city like a hammer. They had to burn everything. They burned the clothes, they burned the corpses. They had to burn everything. Left entire barrios like blackened scars. And that’s when the rats moved in.

They say the rats brought the plague themselves with their black magic. Made way for their move. That’s what they say. I don’t know if its true and I ain’t saying as such, but that’s what I heard. I don’t want them looking for me,

flashing their teeth at me. They’re a part of the city now and that’s that. Like the haffuns, they’re just here and there’s no getting rid of them. So, why bother?

Me, I say keep them. Never been so quiet since they moved in. Got rid of all the filth that was running around here. Don’t see no more gangs, do you? That’s because the rats got rid of them. No more of that.

Sure, I pay them. Why not? If I don’t, I’ll get them gangs back. Better to have the rats than the gangs. And at least them rats understand respect.

— Robin Jestes, Copper Merchant

The Reign of Men does not know what to think of them, but one thing is certain: the "ratmen" are here to stay. They are also the sixth race in the Wicked Fantasy Series, reinventing the classic generic fantasy races with a wicked twist. The ratmen--or "roddun"--have made themselves a home in the Reign of Men... but do they have the will and cunning to stay?

Wicked Fantasy: Scourge of the City includes:


FULL COLOR AND FULLY ILLUSTRATED!
New Ratmen Racial Traits
New Rules for "Mischiefs," the roddun street gangs that rule the Lower City
Gemstone Magic: A trick the roddun "picked up" from the Wicked Fantasy dwarves
New Wizard Archetype: the Junk Wizard
New Ninja Archetype: the Street Assassin
A New Prestige Class: The King Rat
A Robust System for City Control
And More!

138821.name: The Pride of Craftsmen
138821.description:
From the publisher's website:
Why did the haffuns go to meet humanity first? To sweeten us up for the uvandir.

-- common human joke

If you’ve seen one, you’ve seen them all. They stand four feet tall, just up to your waist, but they’re just as wide. Like square bricks. They have big, thick beards and eyes as wide as saucers. And their hands... hands big enough to hold your head. Hands that can squeeze stone until it shatters. Just one of them is strong enough to lift three men on his shoulders and carry them ten miles before breaking a sweat.

And they always smell like work. No matter how much you wash them, no matter how you perfume them, no matter what oils and soaps you use, an uvandir always smells like work.

Like their haffun cousins, the uvandir have found a place in human society. A curmudgeonly place. The haffuns brought service, the gnomes brought their gardens and the uvandir brought invention and innovation. Their skills with mechanics and mathematics amazed human scholars, leaping human knowledge ahead by generations. Of course, the uvandir did not give up such knowledge easily. While there are human clockmakers in the cities, none can deny the craftsmanship and artistry of a dwarven—I mean, uvandir— masterpiece.

It was this innovation that brought the underfolk to humanity in the first place and without the uvandir, they would have never escaped. The cunning of dwarven mining opened up veins of iron, gold and other metals that humanity never dreamed existed. Metalworking unknown to humans. Craftsmanship unknown to humans. Skills undreamed of by humans.

The uvandir never miss an opportunity to remind humans of this.

Ever.

Wicked Fantasy began as a series of articles in Kobold Quarterly Magazine reinventing the "standard races" in fantasy roleplaying. Now, those same articles have been expanded and revised (five times their
original size!) and fit with the PATHFINDER Roleplaying Game.

The next in the series--the Pride of Craftsmen--reveals the story of the uvandir (don't dare call them dwarves) and their unrelenting pride.

Wicked Fantasy: the Pride of Craftsmen includes:

FULL COLOR AND FULLY ILLUSTRATED!
New uvandir Racial Traits including stone made, sleepless and obsessions!
The secrets of gemstone magic (hinted in The Scourge of the City)!
New Archetypes including the gemstone wizard, the woodcutter and the gunslinging watchmaker!
New Feats including Grand Master Craftsman, Hands of Stone, and Stand My Ground!
And More!

138822.name: The World's Worst Blessing
138822.description:
From the publisher's website:
Nobody ever kills a goblin. Better to break seventy-seven mirrors than kill a goblin. That's because goblins -- tiny little green creatures barely taller than a human child -- have the world's worst blessing. Bad luck. The worst kind of luck. And they can throw it...

They are tricksters and con artists, merchants and travelers. The one race that looks absolutely helpless, but may be one of the most dangerous races in all the Known World. They are goblins. Or, as they say "gobowin." And they are now ready to be part of your Wicked Fantasy campaign.

Gobowins: The World's Worst Blessing includes:

FULL COLOR AND FULLY ILLUSTRATED!
New Gobowin Racial Traits
New Feats including Buwuk (Bad Luck) Feats and Big Magic Eye!
Rules for Goblin Caravans!
New Core Class: the Goblin Merchant!
New Oracle Archetype: The Worst Cursed Sheesa!
An Essay on Travel through the Reign of Men!
And More!

138823.name: Shapers of the Land
138823.description:
From the publisher's website:
Much like their cousins, the uvandir and haffuns, they are a clever people. A clever, quiet people. They live in the wilderness, where they bond with the creatures of the land. They are devoted to peace, but I have seen them urged to violence, and it is a sight that would make even the most blood-thirsty ork think twice.

-- Hoband Ugali, Scholar of Vinnick

When the haffuns and uvandir first met with the Reign of Men, there was a small detail the two under-races never revealed: gnomes had been watching men for months. The last of the underpeople, gnomes are, at the same time, the farthest from humans and the closest to them.

Driven by an overpowering sense of empathy, gnomes protect farms and villages on the outskirts of the Reign. At the same time, they keep to themselves, preferring the company of the beasts of the wild. They are true "earth spirits," bound to the land. And that powerful empathy that connects them to all living things is both their greatest strength and their greatest weakness.
Wicked Fantasy Gnomes Contains:

FULL COLOR AND FULLY ILLUSTRATED!
New Gnome Racial Traits including the the Homesteader and the Hunter!
Six Regions to modify your earth-bound gnome!
FIVE New Archetypes including Cavalier, Barbarian, Alchemist and Druid!
The Zaubermach: a new Monk Archetype!
New Feats including Path of the Woods, Friend of the Wilds and Intuit of the Earth!
And More!

138824.name: The Reign of Men: Shadows & Secrets
138824.description:
From the publisher's website:
Men are proud of their Reign. Sometimes, too proud...

The first "downloadable content" for Wicked Fantasy is here! The Reign of Men: Shadows & Secrets details two new organizations for Wicked Fantasy humans as well as a new archetype, a new oracle mystery, new suggestions for rallies and an updated "approved classes" table.

And best of all, it's free!

If you haven't tried Wicked Fantasy yet, get your first taste here. If you like what you see, be sure to check out the Reign of Men as well as the Wicked Fantasy races including orks, gnolls, haffuns and elves!

Wicked Fantasy: Shadows & Secrets contains:

ELEVEN FULL COLOR PAGES!
Full information on two new organizations!
A New Inquisitor Archetype: the Shadow Hand!
A New Oracle Mystery: the Makers
Alternate Rally Rules

138825.description: This pack contains ten pewter cars in five different styles specially designed for Formula Dé. These cars upgrade the ones included in the base game, and are designed to be personalized by painting them in your own colors. These were made by Ral Partha.
138825.name: Formula De pewter cars

138826.description: These are small pewter trains to use with any games in the Empire Builder crayon rail series.
138826.name: Empire Builder pewter miniatures

138827.description: A package of extra scorepads for Yahtzee.
138827.name: Yahtzee: Score Cards

138830.name: Sky Pirates of Neo Terra
138830.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Every year, one Glidewing racer from each tribe participates in the Great Race, and any racer who wins five years in a row selects a leader for the Great Tribal Council. Unfortunately, the Pirate King is trying to win his fifth Great Race this year and plans to name the fiendish Witch Queen leader of all Neo Terra. It’s up to you to win the Great Race and save Neo Terra!

Join Billy Boom Boom on a mission to defeat the tyrannical Pirate King in the Great Race. Take a wild ride through a fantasy world where peace is kept between over a dozen tribes through the tradition of Glidewing racing. Choose from 15 different racers and dive, roll and boost your way to victory on 15 unique tracks. Power-ups, like the Ball and Chain and Scrambler, help you beat your opponents. Collect over a 100 medallions setting records and completing quests. Single Player Story Mode, Multiplayer, Single Player Quick Race, Crystal Collection, and Challenge modes allow you to explore and enjoy every part of Neo Terra.

Source: The Game Website.

138831.name: The Enchanted Garden
138831.description:
The Duchy of Elster lies on the idyllic isle of Lindoss and has enjoyed decades of peace and prosperity. However, all that is about to come to an end.

Two years ago, the Duke's only son Sebastian fled with his lady love Elaine after his father refused to allow them to marry. They were last seen on the day they left the castle, near the Cave of Oracles. The Duke had given up searching for the pair, but failing health has created a potential issue of succession. Waiting in the wings is the Duke's bastard half-brother Rodrick, a petty and cruel-hearted tyrant who dreams of ascending to rule the duchy. The Duke, in one last desperate attempt to find his son, has offered a hefty rewared to anyone who can find and return the pair of lovers. Having recently arrived on the island, the party is drawn by the promised reward. Will they succeed where all others have failed?

The Enchanted garden is an adventure front for the Dungeon World RPG. It presents the skeleton of a complete adventure, inspired by a classic old-school module. With it and a minimal amount of prep work, a GM has enough material for several sessions of play, as well as the set-up for a longer campaign arc.

138832.name: Oath of Steel
138832.description:
From the introduction:
The Godkinds have fallen, save one, Bellona. She works tirelessly to destroy the veil created by the group of defected wizards, Terminus. Sergius works with Terminus to abolish magic in the world and with it the corruption its influence has wrought upon its wielders.

Now, the Champions have united in a final defense of Bellona as the armies of faith stand ready to extinguish the light of magic once and for all.

138835.description: A scorepad refill for Triple Yahtzee.
138835.name: Triple Yahtzee scorepad

138836.name: Snowy Mountain Syndrome
138836.description:
From the introduction:
Its late in 1811 when your wagon train is forced to head up the mountain side somewhere in the Oregon country's cascade mountains. You have to avoid a particularly nasty storm, or at least that is what your scout and mountain man has told you. Now you try in a vain and futile way to take this load of furs and group of settlers through these mountain woods. The goal: to reach Fort Astoria where the Pacific Fur Company's ship Tonquin is waiting for you, payment on delivery. That's when the storm turns north and you start to pray. The snow traps you there in dense woods of evergreens with only the howls of the coyote to pierce the harrowing sound of the wind. After the first day, you find the smoldering remains of one of your folk, only no one is missing.

Under flickering lantern light the doctor asks his strange companion, the native turned white man, why he has tears in his eyes. His answer frightens you all: "One of us is the Coyote Spirit. One of us is a murdering trickster god, trying to do anything to return to the world in human form. We can't let it." It’s the impossible words of a mad man, or so you all thought that second day. However, now it’s the fifth day and stranger things keep happening. Surely this is your last chance to escape this madness and return to the world of the sane, if only the snow wasn't so deep and your feet weren't so cold...

138838.name: Jeopardy! (Xbox 360)
138838.description:
Back of the box

Join Alex Trebek on the set of “America’s Favorite Quiz Show!” Use your quick wits and lightning fast skills to make to Final Jeopardy!

Authentic Game Play!
- Test your knowledge of 2,400 Clues in Jeopardy!, Double Jeopardy!, and Final Jeopardy action!

Brought to you by…
- Enjoy fast-paced commercial break mini-games to be crowned the “Crown Favorite” and unlock prizes for your contestant.

Experience the Thrill!
- Play your favourite quiz game on the Full Jeopardy! Set, complete with lights, cameras, studio audience and the Clue Crew.

138839.name: Karmageddon
138839.description:
This is definitely one of those games where the name directed the mechanic. The concept of karma – good and bad, owing or being owed a debt, and both being a responsibility – and a meta game element of card destruction (making every deck unique) and Real World ™ consequences (in the form of a verbal contract to play) sort of came after the pun of Karma and Armageddon.

The most important part of this game concept is that players may “help” you, even when you don’t want it, and that this will exact a real consequence to clear the debt. Of course, like a gambling debt, this isn’t enforceable. However, entering into the spirit of the thing is the whole point. Why cheat? You’re only robbing yourself…

Set up
There are two elements to this game:

1) A card game played with (what starts out at least as) a standard deck of cards. If there are Jokers, bridge rules or instruction cards, include them.

2) Redemption of Debt where cards used to help other players are IOUs for an hour of a player’s time on any reasonable, legal and responsible task.

To play (the first time) a Sharpie or permanent marker and a standard deck of cards (with jokers) is necessary for 2-4 players. For more than 4 players an extra deck of cards is added for each additional player up to 8 maximum; ideally this should have a different back design or be different size to allow separation for future 2-4 player games. These cards will be torn, ripped and marked, so will likely not be useful for other games afterwards.

NOTE: a deck where cards are missing (otherwise useless!) is fine as a starting deck. Subsequent play will likely not have all the cards anyway, so one or two missing now won’t matter. Reuse/Recycling!!! I feel better already!

Set up for the Meta-Game (the redemption of favours) is merely the agreement of all players that they will commit to an hour of time helping one another for each “Debt Card” they end up with. Where this occurs in game, the card will be ripped in two and both parts signed by helper and helpee; its recommended that a phone number or email address for each is also written down, unless players are well acquainted. The helpee then uses their half in play (for that game only) and later as a reminder that they owe a favour. The helper keeps their half to call in the debt.

NOTE: The hour of time and the task are to be mutually agreed between helper and helpee. It could be anything crom mowing a lawn, babysitting, fixing a computer, whatever is acceptable and doable.

NOTE 2: Debts do NOT cancel out. If Mike owes Paco a debt and vice versa, they don’t call it quits. They both do an hour for the other. This is a matter of honour!

Once a debt is paid, “Done” is written on the helpers half and “Paid” is written on the helpees half. Cards can be kept as a memento, burned ceremoniously or binned.

138840.name: Mercenary Breed (Expanded Edition)
138840.description:
from publisher:

This is the expanded edition of Mercenary Breed.

Mercenary Breed is a space opera sandbox setting where inter-planetary corporations employ mercenaries to enforce laws and enact justice against those who perform oppositional activities.

No matter what kind of sci-fi action and adventure experience you're looking for, it's all possible with Mercenary Breed. The core setting guide gives you the base tools and framework necessary to create a extraordinary setting of your own filled with creatures sourcing from the imagination of the players. Mercenary Breed is meant to be interactive and social along with being fun, fast, and flexible.

Inside the Mercenary Breed core setting guide you will find:

Tools to create new races, home worlds, corporations, bestiary, and missions
Mechanics to support interactive creation between the players and the GM
A sandbox setting ready to be populated
Four playable races including three racial backgrounds
Two usable corporations
Two usable home worlds
Fifteen new adversaries
Three fleshed-out Savage Tales

The Expanded Edition contains:

Additional adversaries (compared to original edition)
Full equipment list
Savage Tales maps
Completely revised tool-kits
Expanded content
A Print-on-Demand friendly layout

Watch for additional content to be released within the standard quarterly issues of Savage Insider!

138841.name: Bance!
138841.description:
The challenge was to create a game that uses all the worst bits of many of the bad games that Flip the Table regularly disparage, including roll-and-play ("Surprise!") and press-your-luck games, but especially Monopoly because @tableflipsyou actually likes Monopoly!

The game essentially consists of players bidding for turn order, with payments paid to subsequent players, with the added complication of the need for money to be exchanged due to restricted access to various denominations. This is followed by choice of a variety of dice movement strategies, in order to arrive back at GO! with exactly $200 (no more, no less).

During movement, if two players arrive at the same square a variant of SNAP (The BANCE! action) allows for players to steal one another's money. NOTE: The game is deliberately complex and there is a strong possibility that it will last for a long time, depending on whether players have realised that it is intended to be torturous.

138843.name: Eagle Alight: The Lunar Lander Board Game
138843.description:
In honour of the FAVOURITE Computer Game (Arcade), Lunar Lander, and the 40th anniversary of the (faked?) Apollo 11 Moon Landings, here is "Eagle Alight", a Lunar Lander inspired board game.

Use fuel, Fuel, FUEL to rotate and slow your craft for an “Eagle Has Landed” moment! This is effectively a simulation of gravity on two hex maps: One with a small playing piece for the larger wide scale view of the moon surface; the other representing the various landing sites by use of layered colour hexes, with a larger playing piece to represent the ship in close-up. In the interest of best representing the original game, the two boards need to be double sided, with one side giving the large scale where the two boards are placed side by side (landscape).

138844.name: Mana Quest Episode I: Imperial Knights
138844.description:
von dem Vorbemerkung:
Trotz der vielversprechenden Kapitelangabe im Untertitel wird diese Kampagne ihre Fortsetzung vermutlich schuldig bleiben. Dieses Abenteuer hier ist die frühe Demoversion des Computerspiels, das nie erscheint, oder die Pilotfolge der sofort wieder abgesetzten TV-Serie. Meiner eigenen Runde habe ich das Abenteuer als nicht einzulösendes Versprechen angekündigt und wir haben es als One-Shot gespielt. Es ist eine Einführung in Retro Phaze und die Gepflogenheiten der 8Bit-Fantasy - nicht fertig, aber durchaus repräsentativ.

From the introduction:
Despite the promising chapter heading in the subtitle for the campaign, its sequel will likely remain undone. This adventure here is the early demo version of the computer game which never appears, or the pilot episode of the immediately cancelled TV series. In my group I have billed the adventure as a not unredeemed pledge and we've played it as a one-shot. It is an introduction to Retro Phaze and the conventions of 8-bit fantasy - not complete, but thoroughly representative.

138845.description: This custom game mat was designed to help manage card placement in the game. It was originally available to Kickstarter backers and also on the Van Ryder Games website for a while.
138845.name: If I'm Going Down Custom Game Mat

138846.name: The Imperium Staple (Issue 2 - Apr 1986)
138846.description: Cover art: 'Female Vargr Entertainer' by Phil Morrissey

138847.name: The Imperium Staple (Issue 3 - May 1986)
138847.description: Cover art: 'Darrian Merchantman Over Lanth Station' by W. Elmer Hinton

138848.name: The Imperium Staple (Issue 4 - Jun 1986)
rpgissuearticle: The Physics of Grav Units and Plates
138848.description: Cover art: 'Crash Landing' by Julie Carter

138850.name: Avenger
138850.description:
From publisher blurb:

General Tiberius Flagg of the U.S. Army offered Zak the opportunity to take part in a special experiment called Project Super Trooper. The process was a success and he became the greatest black ops solider until he started to develop a conscious and started to refuse certain missions. He wanted to be a hero for his country & the people and became the first military crime fighter. Only one soldier, Zackary Knight, was given a replica the full Super Trooper Formula treatment. It was believed the only reason why it was successful was because of the fact Zackary was a mutant (Peak Human Healer). Knight was given the secret identity of Avenger to be a morale-boosting symbol. Rapidly Avenger started to grow more professional and competent; he became the focus of the fight against crime in Megatropolis and acted as a catalyst for the emergence of a string of similar heroes across the US. He would become one of the world's most influential heroes.

138851.name: Black Mamba
138851.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jessica grew up on the street in one roughest low income housing areas in Megatropolis, she doesn’t give respect, it either has to be earned or taken. She has a mouth that won’t quit with a nasty right hook to back it up. She is loyal and will not leave a friend in trouble, but if you have wronged her, she will go out of her way to pay you back tenfold.

A perfect free agent who can dropped into your campaign to be hired out as muscle to local crime bosses or criminal organizations that can afford her rate.

138852.name: The Imperium Staple (Issue 5 - Jul 1986)
rpgissuearticle: Circular Meson and Particle Accelerators in Traveller
Three Dog Night in Road Show

138853.name: The Imperium Staple (Issue 6 - Aug 1986)
138853.description: Cover art: 'Recon Flight' by Phil Morrissey

138854.name: Captain Freedom
138854.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scott is a patriot who believes in the American dream, and in a nation where a person is judged on his or her own merits, not race, religion, or creed. He values loyalty and honesty, and uses these as his code and shield. Though at times he can be gullible, he never forgets a wrong done to him or his friends.

Scott knows he is a hero for the generations and inspiration for many younger superheroes coming up through the ranks; he does his best to live up to these expectations, knowing that even though he is long-lived, this newer generation is the world's next heroes and guardians.

138855.name: Captain Power
138855.description:
From publisher blurb:

He's loud, he's proud, he's the biggest thing to ever hit Iron Bay and Megatropolis - and he's going to make sure you know just how bad he is and how much money he's got.

Captain Power lives life large, just like Rex Love Pecks and other famous men do in the magazines he reads. He's got nothing but the finest women, cars, and lifestyle... with a little help from Zack's money, of course. That's how he rolls.

138856.name: Jacqueline Makarov and The Red Storm
138856.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jacqueline Makarov attended the U.S. Air Force Academy. She specialized in Cyber-Warfare.

Upon graduation, she went to work for Air Force ISR. She was then transferred to Red Storm (Spetsnaz Intelligence), immediately following reorganization.

She was instrumental in preventing multiple cyber attacks against U.S. interests from nongovernmental organizations. Jacqueline always had a special hatred / rivalry with Rebecca LaRue. She wanted to be the #1 in the eyes of the Red Storm and also to Kazlov. She possessed the intelligence and the power, and also the overall killer instinct that would prove her worthy in her coming into power aggressively and politically.

138857.name: Man Hunter
138857.description:
From publisher blurb:

Marc is quite strong and can take very heavy amounts of punishment. He is a surprisingly competent man, with a multitude of useful skills including the use of weaponry, chemistry, mechanics, leadership, driving and physical fighting.

His main driving force is the need to survive, (when he’s not trying to be killed by The Widow, his Ex-wife); which will force him to do great things.

He possesses a strong personality and is always set on survival. In fact, he often sets his own survival before those of others, and can appear very abrasive and off-setting (womanizing, whoremonger, that cannot tear himself away from strip clubs).

How to use Man-Hunter:

Perhaps the characters need a vehicle to be created for the new fledging team and hear of Marc, or perhaps the com across the Bounty hunter while they both go after the same villain. Or perhaps they seen a body wrapped in chains being thrown into the river by shady looking men. Saving the man’s life they meet Man-Hunter who survived yet another attempt on his life by his wife.

138858.name: Sasha O'Hare
138858.description:
From publisher blurb:

Despite her vast military background her true inspiration to become a police officer was that her brother and little sister fell victim of a hit and run from the Delucci crime family she found this out when she was taking holiday leave to be with her family to celebrate Christmas, that’s when she first met Connor O. York and he filled her in on the tragic incident and he also told her of the calling card the was almost always left by the Delucci crime family, Black roses was always left on the bodies of their fallen victims. Connor was dealing with this for quite some time before this incident had taken place, Sasha then had herself transferred from special forces and into Megatropolis PD, she vowed to take all of them down and she will continue to fight for all the other families who has lost their loved ones in this similar fashion.

138859.name: Sledge Hammer
138859.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a big bad biker for your campaign, well here’s one for you, Sledge Hammer isn't much for talking, he lets his fist do his talking or anything he can grab to beat some punk down is fair game, he also thinks if he and his brothers in the Hell riders jump on a guy, the guy should have had more friends. Sledge also has to prove he is the baddest, toughest, meanest S.O.B around knowing he has nearly invulnerable skin and pushing the amount of damage he can take to the utmost extreme.

For the most part he's meant to be a razor edged face (good guy) but can easily be tailored as a villain for your campaign needs.

138860.name: The Imperium Staple (Issue 7 - Sep 1986)
rpgissuearticle: Review: Star Port Module One: The Hotel Complex
138860.description: Cover art: 'Survey Team' by Phil Morrissey

138861.name: The Justice Corp
138861.description:
From publisher blurb:

The wait is now over. Have you ever wanted a Superhero Military Group to throw into your campaign? If so, then this is the pdf for you and your campaign “The Justice Corp “.

What is The Justice Corp? Well in short, “The Justice Corp” is the first hero group to receive official recognition from the U.S. Government, as well as, recognition from other International organizations.

National governments realized that the Earth could be threatened by alien races or other despots with world-wide ambitions. “The Justice Corp” was therefore sponsored by the National Security Council of the U.S. Government, and by the United Nations. So does this sound like a good fit or a good start? You decide!

138862.name: The Patriot
138862.description:
From publisher blurb:

For heroism in the line of duty, he was decorated with numerous medals, including the Purple Heart. Being the no nonsense guy that he was he was chosen to be the Avengers successor and took part in the Super Trooper Formula. Project: Patriot (The third incarnation of the Super Trooper Formula which in turn created The Patriot) In doing so granted him amazing abilities added already to his natural skill arguably makes him one of the most dangerous individuals the world has ever known.

138863.name: Tiger King
138863.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tiger King is very over confident and he prefers to operate alone and avoid alliances. He also tends to consider any setback as a defeat, and he absolutely hates being touched by anybody not worthy of touching him, and generally will respond in a violent manner.

The Tiger King sometimes displays an incredibly spiteful streak, often leading him to dispose of his allies, seemingly just because he can. He also has a soft spot for revenge, and an unquenchable amount of cruelty.

138864.name: Tonfun
138864.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first installment of the main characters for Iron Bay: introducing Tonfun.

Tonfun is ruthless, but has a compassion for those who can't defend themselves; He hates weakness, but believes woman especially older woman should be revered. When accepting a contract he follows it to the ends of the Earth. But Will not except a contract to kill woman or children. Tonfun is extremely honorable but has very little Mercy. He is an enigma and very complicated person.

138865.name: Widow
138865.description:
From publisher blurb:

What happens when a Femme Fatale becomes a bitter betrayed, ex-wife to a scum bag mercenary? The Widow knows!!

This is one woman you never want to cross or get on her bad side. Widow comes from a long line of Femme Fatales, who know how to take care of business, like when it comes to men.

How to use widow: If the heroes are looking for an assassin they could come across Widow who is either the assassin or tracking down the same killer, working with or against the heroes. She could also seduce one of the heroes to help her complete a mission.

138866.name: World Watch
138866.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome back true believers as the epic saga continues with the new edition to Iron Bay the new sourcebook World Watch. This sourcebook has the easy flexibility to be dropped in and or added to any campaign for Mutants & Masterminds 3rd edition. World Watch comes fully loaded and ready to go with new equipment, characters, and an in depth history of World Watch. So if your campaign is in trouble then look no further call on World Watch! Stay tuned, coming up next The Justice Corp.

138867.name: The Imperium Staple (Issue 8 - Oct 1986)
rpgissuearticle: At the TAS: Edard Josef Shaw
At the TAS: TAS Form 2b: Personal Data Form
Low Berth Naval Duty Pay Changes

138868.name: The Imperium Staple (Issue 9 - Nov 1986)
rpgissuearticle: At the TAS: Cpt. Josue Lopez de Don Diego III
Interstellar Confederation for Law and Order

138869.description:
Lead your people to greatness by training them in the ways of war, commerce, magic, labor, or entertainment in this fun and original deck building board game.

The people in the Empires of Zidal require your guidance! Train the children in your empire to become military workers who can attack other players and take their game resources. Alternatively you can train your children to become market workers who can manipulate the in game supply and demand driven market to your advantage. Grow the power of your empire by constructing buildings to give benefits to workers in specific employment branches. In total, there are 5 different employment branches which children can be trained in (military, market, magic, labor, or entertainment). Each branch has their own unique effects and strategies for winning. In the end whichever empire is able to gain the most signets wins!

Empires of Zidal is a deck building game for 2 to 4 players. The game is set in the land of Zidal and every player is the ruler of one of Zidal's empires. The deck you build throughout the game consists of people from within your own empire. Will you decide to create a military empire and populate your realm with generals, knights, and archers? Will you take advantage of the market by training your children to be merchants, negotiators, and analysts? Will you populate your empire with magic, labor, or entertainment workers... or a combination of two or more employment branches? It's up to you to decide.
138869.name: Empires of Zidal

138872.name: The Imperium Staple (Issue 11 - Apr 1987)
rpgissuearticle: The Editor is Dead; Long Live the Editor!

138873.name: Continuum (Issue 1 - Mar 1987)
rpgissuearticle: Fanzines and Newsletters, a Familiarization Guide
138873.description:
From the What is Continuum? article:

CONTINUUM was founded to contain discussions, letters, non-standard articles, and any other misc. little tidbits, articles, news, and other material that is not accepted or appropriate elsewhere (not necessarily all for TRAVELLER).

138875.name: Lands of Ara Compendium 2011
138875.description:
from the Introduction:

Welcome to The Lands of Ara Compendium 2011. An alternate title for this publication could be The Lands of Ara Compendium 2009-2011, since it represents a condensation of the monsters, spells, NPCs, traps, magic items and similar gameable stuff that accumulated over The Lands of Ara blog’s first 28 months.

When I started the blog in September 2009, my sole intent was to translate my Lands of Ara campaign setting into old-school D&D terms using Labyrinth Lord, and to use the blog to document that effort.

However, even before that campaign got underway in January 2010, I engaged with the vibrant Old-School Renaissance blogging community, an activity which has had an overwhelmingly positive effect upon my refereeing skills and overall passion for the game. While there is no way for me to adequately repay my blogospheric companions for their invaluable advice, inspiration, and the vast amount of awesome gaming content I have read and downloaded over the past two and a half years, this Compendium is my own small way of attempting to “pay it forward” and to contribute something back into the collective.

138876.name: The Words
138876.description:
From the rules:
You know the words. Maybe you read them in a loathsome book penned by a madman. Maybe someone cruel whispered them to you. Maybe you had the misfortune to overhear them. Maybe they were taught to you by someone you hate.

You can say the words and terrible things happen...you can make terrible things happen. And maybe you do.

[...]

But someone said the words on TV. Some mad fool. And the words went everywhere.

138877.name: Dark Side of the Moon
videogamehonor: 1999 D.I.C.E. Adventure Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)
138877.description:
From the Back of the Box

"Prepare yourself for the most revolutionary adventure game ever created.

As the central figure in an epic science fiction story, you'll struggle to learn the ultimate secret behind your uncle's mysterious death. Your quest will take you to the depths of a dangerous mining colony on the far side of the galaxy. But be warned. Nothing is what it seems. And the stakes are much higher than you could ever dream.

Go beyond static screens, expressionless polygons, and randomly placed puzzles to the next generation of adventure gaming: Dark Side of the Moon - an experience so real and so suspenseful, you'll have to keep reminding yourself: It's only a game. It's only a game. Welcome to the Dark Side.

Dark Side of the Moon is a sci-fi adventure that will immerse you in 360° of completely seamless, incredibly realistic, motion-picture quality gaming."

138878.description: Tiny pewter miniatures to use with Battlestations and represent the various races found in the game. These 15mm figure are about the height of a US Penny.
138878.name: Battlestations miniatures

138879.description: These starship miniatures are for Battlestations.
138879.name: Battlestations Starship miniatures

138880.name: Banco Imobiliário: Cidade Olímpica
138880.description: Brazilian version of Monopoly with Rio de Janeiro's famous neighborhoods and natural features wiyh the Olympic Games theme.

138881.description: Official sleeves for Ascension game and expansions.
138881.name: Ascension: Card Sleeves

138882.description: A storage box for Ascension + a set of sleeves for the cards.
138882.name: Ascension: Box and Sleeve Combo

138883.description: A small cloth bag to hold the Honor tokens.
138883.name: Ascension: Honor Token Bag

138884.name: Continuum (Issue 2 - Jun 1987)
rpgissuearticle: Genetic Manipulation and Created Races, Part 1
How I Became Hooked on Traveller
138884.description: Subtitled: A Field Guide for Intergalactic Travellers

138885.description: These small plastic Cthulhu figures are sculpted just like the ones that come with Unspeakable Words by Playroom Entertainment.
138885.name: Unspeakable Words: Black Cthulhu Mini Mythos

138886.name: Continuum (Issue 3 - Aug 1987)
rpgissuearticle: Genetic Manipulation and Created Races, Part 2
138886.description: Subtitled: A Field Guide for Intergalactic Explorers

138887.description: These small sculpted figures are for use with The Call of Cthulhu: LCG. The bag brings figures in 3 sizes.
boardgameaccessory: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game
138887.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Bag of Cthulhu

138888.description: Card tins for Call of Cthulhu CCG. These tins featured various artwork from the game.
boardgameaccessory: Call of Cthulhu: Collectible Card Game
138888.name: Call of Cthulhu Card Coffin Tin

138889.name: Linux Tycoon
138889.description:
Linux Tycoon is the premier Linux Distro Building Simulator game in the universe.

(Truth be told: It's probably the only Linux Distro Building Simulation game in the universe.)

So what exactly do you do in a Linux Distro Building game?

So glad you asked! Here's some examples of the thrilling challenges you'll find in Linux Tycoon:

1) Analyzing and selecting software packages.
2)Fixing Bugs.
3)Managing volunteers and paid staff.
4)Keeping the total size (in MB) of your Distro at a reasonable level.
5)And so much more!

Source: The Game Website.

138890.name: Dungeon (Issue 211 - Feb 2013)
138890.description:
Contents

1 Beyond Expectations by Christopher Perkins
Great adventures push the boundaries of the D&D® game by showing us things we’ve never seen before.

2 Glitterdust by Will Doyle
King Sunfire, the lord of the pixies, has a most important quest for you. Watch out for hungry bats and screaming scarecrows! A D&D adventure for 1st-level pixie characters.

25 Fall of the Gray Veil by Christopher Perkins
The village of Baron's Hill has fallen under a strange curse, and there can be no peace until the curse is lifted. A D&D adventure for characters of levels 2–4.

63 Beyond the Crystal Cave by Steve Townshend
As the village of Crystalbrook battles blue- skinned monsters, a pair of star-crossed lovers find solace in a crystal cave beyond which lies an enchanted garden. Few who visit the garden ever return. Will you? This D&D adventure for characters of levels 1–3 was originally published as a D&D EncountersTM season and is inspired by the classic AD&D adventure module UK1, Beyond the Crystal Cave, by Dave J. Browne, Tom Kirby, and Graeme Morris.

138891.name: Das Königreich der Tiere
138891.description:
Objective:
be the first getting 7 'Wissens-Bons'
- acting by turns -
Each player moves along a travel-route all over the world. Stepping on a 'star' space you must give correct answer (sometimes multiple choice) to receive one 'Bon'.

138892.name: Storm Front
138892.description:
From the publishers website:
All-Shaking Thunder

It’s been a tense couple of years (or couple of decades, if we’re being accurate) in the Sixth World. Aztlan and Amazonia have been slugging it out. Great dragons have turned on each other, testing old alliances and forging new ones. Governor Kenneth Brackhaven of Seattle is facing pressure unlike ever he’s ever seen, and scandals seem on the verge of overwhelming him. In Denver, a powerful dragon and an angry elf are set to butt heads in ways that will shake up the whole city—and provide new opportunities for an old enemy. And on top of that, a new plague is spreading through the world, and the denizens of JackPoint aren’t immune to its effects.

All this tension has been building up, and in Storm Front, it breaks. Storm Frontprovides background and updates on these and other plotlines changing the shape of the Sixth World. The shadows are shifting, and runners need to move fast if they want to earn a paycheck—or if they want to keep from being crushed as the powers of the world slug it out. The world is changing, but some things remain the same. Power will corrupt. Money will flow to those who already have it. And shadowrunners will scramble to make a living without selling their soul.

Storm Front provides plot information as well as adventure hooks that are compatible with Shadowrun, Fourth Edition while also laying the groundwork for the upcoming Shadowrun, Fifth Edition. As a bridge between the two editions, this book is useful to all Shadowrun players, setting the stage for explosive stories and memorable campaigns.

'Additional Publisher Blurb:

Aztlan and Amazonia slugging it out. Great dragons turning on each other. Governor Kenneth Brackhaven of Seattle facing pressure unlike any he's ever seen. A powerful dragon and elf on the verge of ravaging Denver. And on top of that, a new plague is spreading through the world, and the denizens of JackPoint aren't immune to its effects. All this tension has been building up, and in Storm Front, it breaks. Storm Front provides background and updates on these and other plotlines changing the shape of the Sixth World. Storm Front is compatible with Shadowrun, Fourth Edition while also laying the groundwork for the upcoming Shadowrun, Fifth Edition.
• Provides plot developments and changes that will fuel conversation and speculation in Shadowrun fans, including the end of the Aztlan-Amazonia war, the death of a great dragon, an earth-shaking conflict between the dragon Ghostwalker and the elf Harlequin, and a growing scandal facing Governor Kenneth Brackhaven of Seattle
• Sets up plot developments that will be critical in the upcoming Shadowrun, Fifth Edition. Pieces of this book are being used heavily in promotional materials tied to the release of Fifth Edition, helping whet customers appetite for the full book.
• Includes statistics of some notable Sixth World characters, including the great dragon known as Sirrurg the Destroyer.
• Provides game information, plot hooks, and other statistics to make it easier to use this material in ongoing campaigns.
• Concludes with the departure of a beloved Shadowrun character that is sure to getfans of the game talking.

138893.description:
Intro: A set of 32 GamePatra that are based on characters of forthcoming online game - 'War of Fascinating Galaxies' (WarOFGa). These trading cards make learning and memorising Physics concepts fun and part of a game.

Aim: The game can be played in many way and the aim is to gather maximum number of cards for your collection.

Game Play: Each player brings a pack or all equally divide a pack
Both players reads out the number on the card at the top
The payer with the lesser numbered card can ask for the title of the other player’s card. If she/he can recall the contents of the card, then she/he does not have to surrender the card
138893.name: WarOFGa Trading Cards

138896.description:
Sharrash is a mysterious and well-organized community of mutant rats endowed with inhuman intelligence. They live underground, in tunnels and canals of the destroyed cities, along with degenerate humans and mutants who serve the Sharrash. They do not allow strangers anywhere near them and fiercely defend their nests, and their fighters will not hesitate to give their life for the pack.

The main advantages of the Neuroshima Hex! Sharrash army are mobility of HQ, the ability to blow up even the fastest enemy units and to paralyze the slower ones, and the possibility of bypassing the enemy's defense lines thanks to the mortars. Another advantage of the Sharrash is a difficult to eliminate Foundation Tile (Hole), which can easily thwart the enemy's plans.

Sharrash's disadvantage is a smaller number of fighting units than in other armies, their low mobility, low toughness and initiative, as well as a complete lack of armors.
138896.name: Neuroshima Hex! Sharrash
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

138898.name: Monopoly: Gelsenkirchen
138898.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Gelsenkirchen, in Germany.

138900.name: Optimum
138900.description: Optimum is a board game published by the christin youth organisation Svenska Kyrkans Unga in the Evangelical Lutheran Church of Sweden. The game is about sustainable development and environmental impact. The game is card driven, and by certain cards the players can produce, investing in human rights, reduce the greenhouse effect or acquire political influence. In the game you have to design your in-game society as optimally as possible so that you can win the game.

138902.name: Monopoly: Herzogenaurach
138902.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Herzogenaurach,a city in Germany.

138903.name: Monopoly: Saarland
138903.description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Saarland, a region/federal state in Germany.

138907.name: Fringe Wars
138907.description:
On a desolate fringe-world, miners discover powerful technology buried in the ruins of an ancient alien civilization. Soon the wasteland erupts in conflict as desperate factions vie for control of the region. Mercenaries from far-away lands converge on the wastes: tech-wizards, warriors in robotic armor, zog-riders and archaeologists, all eager to be hired and join in the impending struggle. Battle is coming. Rally your forces and outgun the opposition!

Fringe Wars is a fast-paced board game where 2-5 players lead small, competing factions hell-bent on controlling the wasteland and procuring the alien artifacts it holds. Players use hero cards to recruit and deploy troops, and fight for control of key locations. Hero cards can be used in combinations to make actions stronger, and deciding how to use each card is vital to winning. Players attack each other and the vicious beasts that live in the wasteland to take control of territories. The player who is able to obtain the most alien artifacts through the heated battle is the winner.

138908.name: Dagger: Supplemental Rules for Classic Role-playing with Children
138908.description:
from the Introduction:

DAGGER is designed to introduce kids five years and over to classic-style fantasy role-playing. This supplement uses common, core mechanics found in most old-school fantasy role-playing games. However, these core mechanics are reduced to only the most basic elements necessary for play. This effectively simplifies the game so that players as young as five years can easily grasp the basic concepts. The rules presented here are supplementary (i.e. they are not all-encompassing) and it is assumed that the Referee already possesses a general knowledge of some form of classic fantasy role-playing. Any aspect of play not covered in these rules should be handled by the Referee, “filling in the gaps” as necessary with his own rulings, or rules from another classic fantasy system. This is a practice that is expected and encouraged.

User note:
Although the subtitle says "Supplemental Rules" this book contains everything needed to play. The rules cover character advancement up to level 5.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
138909.name: Daughters of the Deep
138909.description:
From the PDF:

This adventure is designed to be used with the game supplement, SEA MAIDENS OF SAN GROPIA. If you do not have that item, don't worry, it is written generically enough that you can insert it into any campaign/system with minor alteration (It is Compatible as-is with 1st Edition, and OSRIC rules).
The nature of the adventure requires that characters enter and explore an environment not normal to their experience. In this case, they must spend at least some of their time below the surface of the open sea. This creates extreme stress upon the characters as it requires them to have a means of breathing underwater, as well as dealing with the penalties that occur when combating creatures that dwell in such a place. It is recommended that you provide the characters access to minor magic (i.e., potions of water breathing)that will aide them in their exploration. (An NPC within the village will have at least 6 such items when the characters arrive)
Because of the condition just described, it is more favorable for the players to have access to character classes that are beyond the basic core group(cleric, fighter, magic user, thief). By allowing druids and monks, for example, the party might possess skills outside the basic classes that could enhance their chances of success. If you do not wish to allow such classes, then it would be prudent to provide nominal magic items that might help the group in ways that, those mentioned, might have.
The beginning of this scenario takes place on land, along the shore of some continent-realm where coastal villages are common. The party of characters will likely arrive by means of roads and horseback. There are no random monster encounters necessary for them to deal with en route unless you wish to create and conduct them yourself.

138910.name: Shadowrun Beginner Box Set
138910.description:
Form the publishers webpage:
Introductory Box Set
The Shadowrun Introductory Box Set is the easiest way to get involved in the intrigue, grit, and action of one of the most enduring role-playing settings of all time.

•A compact rulebook designed to be accessible and simple to use.
•Adventures to provide hours of gaming fun.
•A world book to give the flavor and background of the Shadowrun setting.
•Pre-generated characters players can use to jump right into an adventure.
•Maps to help players and gamemasters keep track of the action.
Grab your dice, pack your gear, and get ready to survive the worst the Sixth World has to offer!

138911.name: Porphyry and Asphodel
138911.description:
Publisher blurb:
A classic Quest though the land of Dreams written by one of the most passionate and accomplished writers of Call of Cthulhu's early years, Penelope Love. Dare to revisit the Enchanted Forest and the impenetrable city of Thran in a desperate journey to save the soul of an Arkham girl cursed to unending slumber.

from the credit page:
This scenario was written by Penelope Love and published in the Chaosium Digest, Volume 8, number 6 (November 6, 1994).

138912.name: Deadwave
138912.description:
Publisher blurb:
Somebody is back from the grave. Somebody bad. Somebody the Investigator killed with good reason. Somebody who should have stayed dead. Somebody who didn't. Deadwave is a classic Call of Cthulhu scenario of zombie-fuelled revenge, written by one of the game's favourite authors.

from the credits:
This scenario was written by Mark Morrison and first published in the Chaosium Digest, Volume 9, Number 4 (December , 1994).

138915.name: Dotso
138915.description:
User Summary

Dotso is a reimplementation of the pen-and-paper game Boxes for DOS. Players take turns connecting boxes with lines oriented orthagonally. Each complete box created by one player counts as one point, the winner being the player who can create the most boxes.

138918.name: Doubolo
138918.description:
User Summary

Doubolo is a Reversi game in which the board has unplayable squares located throughout the board. Two starting locations exist as well, causing vulnerability on both sides of the board at the beginning of the game.

138919.name: Drum Blaster
138919.description:
User Summary

Drum Blaster is a drum or rhythm simulator. A host of options are available to the player, including various animated drummers and a wide array of sounds.

138920.name: Duel 2000
138920.description:
User Summary

Duel 2000 is a little shooter in which the player flies their space ship within the confines of the screen while avoiding the gravity well of the planet at the centre. An enemy ship also flies within the confines, and a battle to the death ensues, with the ships and bullets being pulled into arcs around the central planet. The walls can be toggled to be wrap-around or bouncy, and the planet can cause destruction or be bouncy as well. Overheating one's engine will cause it to fail, and will likely cause the player's death.

138923.name: In A Different Light
138923.description:
from the credits:
This scenario was written by Dean Engelhardt and published in the Chaosium Digest, Volume 29, Number 12 (January 2000).

from the introduction:
This scenario pits the Investigators against a terrible and sinister plot instigated by a mysterious and possibly inhuman power. Investigators with some prior experience of the Cthulhu Mythos will find their knowledge gives them a slight advantage. Little, however, will prepare them for the terrible awakenings that soon take place both within themselves and in a dark and hidden site unknown to man.

The hideous events detailed herein are nominally set in Arkham and Boston during the Spring of 1928. However, the Keeper needs to change little to relocate the scenario elsewhere or to a different year.

138924.name: Mutable Deceptions, Vol. 1: Jazz Age Newspapers
138924.description:
Publisher's product summary:

Mutable Deceptions, Volume 1 is a commercial prop resource that we have released to help gamers with the perennial problem of making their own realistic-looking 1920s or 1930s newspaper props. Many games — Lovecraftian roleplaying games in particular — place a heavy emphasis on newspaper clippings as clues, but making ones that look authentic is actually pretty hard. The templates that come with Mutable Deceptions make the job much easier: all you need to do is pick one of the 14 differently sized/shaped/formatted templates, open it up in Adobe Reader and type your own text in for the headlines, bylines and article body. You can even do some substantial formatting of the article body to squeeze text together or space it apart so that your text fits into the template field just right.

138926.name: EGA Trek
138926.description:
User Summary

EGA Trek is a space exploration game in which the player commands a ship called the U.S.S. Lexington under the faction of the "Union." The enemies are called the Mongols, and can be found throughout the sectors in space: 8x8 sectors within 8x8 regions.
Energium can be harvested with the correct equipment, scanners map out territory, and weapons and shields aid in combat.

138927.name: Electranoid
138927.description:
User Summary

Electranoid is a 'Break-Out' style game in which the player controls a paddle with which he or she hits a ball up into an array of bricks. Destroying bricks this way yields points, power-ups, and eventually advances the player to the next level.

138928.name: Epic Baseball
138928.description:
User Summary

Epic Baseball is a baseball simulator. The player manages a fantasy team in a fantasy league, dictating what each player should focus on. Pitchers can be told to pitch a certain type of pitch, batters can be directed, and so on. The computer will play out each play, calculating the outcome of the player's decisions.

138932.name: Sid & Al's Incredible Toons
138932.description:
This video game is designed with the same style as that of The Incredible Machine, except that the game took place on a cartoon stage instead of a laboratory. The game focuses on the humorous adventures of the game's two main characters, Sid E. Mouse and Al E. Cat, as each tries to make life unbearable for the other. It features 100 puzzles and an editor which allows the player to design his or her own puzzles. The main objective of the game is to finish a "puzzle-piece" photograph by completing each puzzle. When each puzzle (or level) is completed a missing piece on the photograph is replaced.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sid & Al's Incredible Toons", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

bgaccessoryversion: Merrian Webster fourth large-print paperback Edition
Merrian Webster third mass-market paperback Edition
138934.description: This dictionary is designed for Scrabble players. It contains most words that are considered valid by the National Scrabble Association.
138934.name: The Official Scrabble Players Dictionary

138935.description: An extra set of 100 flamingo miniatures for Trailer Park Wars.
138935.name: Trailer Park Wars: Yard Flamingos

138937.name: Hierofania
138937.description:
Ten years ago, Utrecht, God of Justice, disappeared.

Nobody knows if he’s dead, lost, or in hiding.

Utrecht’s followers, his Knights, first lost their magic and then the respect of the people.

Some Knights left the order and joined the worship of other gods. Others joined the army and fought for reasons other than their faith.

Some stayed loyal. They fought and died for Justice. All that remains of them now are their names carved in stone.

Some remain, like scattered embers of a fire that once lit the world.

Source: The Game Website.

138938.name: Pathfinder Map Pack: Sewer System
138938.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Down and Dirty

Adventures are at their grossest when they descend into the reeking cesspools and disgusting tunnels winding beneath the largest cities, sewers of such size and complexity as to be dungeons in their own rights. Whether your heroes are chasing thieves or clearing out sewer-stalkers, no Game Master wants to spend time drawing drainage ditches and filthy channels. Fortunately, with Paizo Publishing’s latest Pathfinder Map Pack, you don’t have to! This line of gaming accessories provides simple and elegant tools for the busy Game Master. Inside, you’ll find 18 captivating 5" 8" map tiles that can be combined into a variety of maze-like sewers, including:


Tunnel Junctions
Pipe Drains
Access Ladders
Creature Lair
Ravine
Collapsed Wall
Junk Pile
Barred Culvert
Wererat Shrine


Pathfinder Map Pack: Sewer System also connects with Flip-Mat: Watch Station, Map Pack: Mines, and others, allowing you to build a customizable underworld of your own design, ensuring that you’ll always be ready whenever adventuring gets down and dirty!

Wet, dry, and permanent markers erase from the tiles! With revised packaging that includes a reusable box for easy storage, Map Packs have never been so useful!

138939.name: Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Battlefield
138939.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Whether your players are leading the charge or fleeing a superior force, no Game Master wants to spend time drawing sites for ambushes and epic clashes. Fortunately, with Paizo Publishing’s latest Pathfinder Flip-Mat, you don’t have to! This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use and captivatingly detailed fantasy set-pieces for the busy Game Master. Whether it’s used during a huge organized conflict or simply anytime a fight breaks out, this double-sided combat map is the perfect place to resolve battles!
This portable, affordable map measures 24" x 30" unfolded, and 8" x 10" folded. Its coated surface can handle any dry erase, wet erase, or even permanent marker. Usable by experienced GMs and novices alike, Pathfinder Flip-Mats fit perfectly into any Game Master's arsenal!
On tabletops across the world, the Flip-Mat Revolution is changing the way players run their fantasy roleplaying games! Why take the time to sketch out ugly scenery on a smudgy plastic mat when dynamic encounters and easy clean-up are just a Flip away?

138940.name: Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Arcane Dungeons
138940.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Put the magic back into your adventures with Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Arcane Dungeons. The secrets of two mystical dungeon levels wait to be discovered on this huge double-sided full-color tactical map. Two sides depict such classic magical set pieces and threats as a casting chamber, summoning runes, and magical laboratory, perfect for any fantasy roleplaying campaign.
This portable, affordable map measures 24" x 30" unfolded, and 8" x 10" folded. Its coated surface can handle any dry erase, wet erase, or even permanent marker. Usable by experienced GMs and novices alike, Pathfinder Flip-Mats fit perfectly into any Game Master's arsenal!
On tabletops across the world, the Flip-Mat Revolution is changing the way players run their fantasy roleplaying games! Why take the time to sketch out ugly scenery on a smudgy plastic mat when dynamic encounters and easy clean-up are just a Flip away?

138941.description:
